programme.title: Crawl
programme.desc: A woman and her injured father become trapped by floodwaters in their home during a hurricane. With the storm strengthening, they soon discover an even greater threat than the rising water level: a relentless attack from a pack of giant alligators.

programme.title: Secrets of Supercheap Shopping
programme.desc: Will greengrocer Simon Fishwicks pick-up lines have customers picking up his produce? And which lucky shoppers will bag one of Discount Dragons treasure chests of bargain bounty?

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Shopping from home.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry and Simon head to Lancashire where Simon finds a 1980s glass cabinet he wants to turn into a modern grandfather clock. Henry picks up a drum kit and relives his youth.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The guys get a once-in-a-lifetime invitation to a mammoth Newport mansion and theres a mind-blowing collection of vintage petroliana in Massachusetts.

programme.title: Help! We Bought a Village
programme.desc: At his fire-damaged settlement in France, Dan makes a chateau watertight. In Italy, Lucie and Jerrys earthquake-damaged village is dealt a further blow as its hit by floods.

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jerry and Christine Steeles love of South Africa began over 20 years ago. Several trips later, theyve decided to spend part of their retirement in a second home among the stunning beaches and national parks of its world-famous Garden Route.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me: The Professionals
programme.desc: Restaurants go head-to-head to win £1000. In Yorkshire, purveyors of posh nosh The Barn take on Disco Kitchens eclectic menu of French classics, and Scandi-inspired restaurant Fint.

programme.title: Kirstie and Phils Love It or List It
programme.desc: In Lancing, Gloria and Tom are at stalemate over their Victorian semi by the sea. Can Kirstie work her magic, or will Phils enticing properties lure them to list it? (S7 Ep2)

programme.title: Jasmine Harmans Renovation in the Sun
programme.desc: No stranger to helping others find their perfect place in the sun, Jasmine Harman takes the plunge and transforms a run-down villa into a family home on the Costa del Sol.

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Kevin and Sally have decided to move to the Greek island of Kefalonia. They have a budget of £200,000 for a property with enough space to rent out rooms to guests so that they can still earn an income. Laura Hamilton shows them five great options.

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Clara and David have fallen in love with Fuerteventura and want a holiday home there. Will a cutesy compact place or a spacious suntrap of an apartment deliver their sun-drenched dream?

programme.title: Kirstie and Phils Love It or List It
programme.desc: Kirstie and Phil visit Swansea to help Sarah and Caradog, who moved into their four-bed home shortly before their third child was born in 2008 and have been struggling for space ever since.

programme.title: Secrets of Supercheap Shopping
programme.desc: Will greengrocer Simon Fishwicks pick-up lines have customers picking up his produce? And which lucky shoppers will bag one of Discount Dragons treasure chests of bargain bounty?

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: Its the final and the bakers make classic iced buns and a jaw-dropping tower of French delights. Whose biggest cake in Bake Off history will take showstopping victory?

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: Britains sharpest armchair critics share more of their sharp, insightful, passionate and sometimes emotional critiques of the weeks biggest and best shows on television.

programme.title: George Michael: Portrait of an Artist
programme.desc: Fellow musicians and friends who knew him best candidly open up about the life and times of singer George Michael.

programme.title: Shiva Baby
programme.desc: While at a Jewish funeral service with her parents, a college student has an awkward encounter with her sugar daddy and her ex-girlfriend.

programme.title: Worlds Apart
programme.desc: The treasure hunt reaches its final stop as the last three duos face the toughest challenges yet in a high-stakes finale. Wholl take home the £50k and an unlikely friend for life?

programme.title: Game of Wool: Britains Best Knitter
programme.desc: Tom Daley hosts, as 10 amateur knitters knock needles to be crowned knitting champion. Wholl stitch without a glitch? And whose Fair Isle will be bottom of the pile?

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off: An Extra Slice
programme.desc: Joe Wilkinson, Cherish Finden and Katherine Ryan join Jo and Tom in patisserie paradise. Whose creations surpassed expectations? And whose dome sent them home?

programme.desc: Shopping from home.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: In the East Midlands, Henry finds his dream Russian motorbike and sidecar dating back to World War II, while Simon snaps up a trendy 1970s fire surround.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The guys pick one of the biggest barns theyve ever seen in a sprawling Connecticut dairy farm and find some ultra-rare skis for a Model T Ford.

programme.title: Help! We Bought a Village
programme.desc: As the seasons change, mother nature presents new problems for Patrick and Mihaelas country estate. And in Italy, can Lucie and Jerry turn a profit from their olive oil?

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Nurses Philip Vaux and Alec Billen from Somerset have been dreaming about owning a place in Spain for the last 10 years. Now theyve decided to buy a holiday home in the beautiful province of Almeria in south-east Spain.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me: The Professionals
programme.desc: In Manchester, first to host are David and Rachel of Haydens Kitchen at The Gallows. Saju and Ganga from South Indian restaurant Ammas Canteen host next, and then Jo and Mike of gastropub The Waterside host.

programme.title: Kirstie and Phils Love It or List It
programme.desc: In Cowbridge, Amy and Louis need help with a home that, on the surface, looks picture perfect, but its dysfunctional layout has made Amy long for pastures new. Louis believes Kirstie can come up with a plan to turn it into a forever family home.

programme.title: Jasmine Harmans Renovation in the Sun
programme.desc: As the enormity of the build sets in, work gets underway to make the place liveable before the family move in. And Jasmine visits a friend for some renovation inspiration.

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jean Johansson heads to Mayenne in France to help engineer Martin and retired gardener Mandy find their dream forever home. She shows them five great properties for their budget of £50,000.

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Mandy and Steve want to permanently relocate to Paphos, Cyprus - a place that they already call home. Can a tantalising townhouse or a beautiful bungalow deliver the Cypriot charm?

programme.title: Kirstie and Phils Love It or List It
programme.desc: In Lancing, Gloria and Tom are at stalemate over their Victorian semi by the sea. Can Kirstie work her magic, or will Phils enticing properties lure them to list it? (S7 Ep2)

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Does food keep you warm? Which foods cause the most flatulence? Plus: the miraculous healing powers of crab shells. And Matt investigates fish preservation.

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: Its the final and the bakers make classic iced buns and a jaw-dropping tower of French delights. Whose biggest cake in Bake Off history will take showstopping victory?

programme.title: 24 Hours in AandE
programme.desc: Steven has life-threatening injuries after a 22-foot wall collapsed on him at work and buried him beneath. Coby has crashed his motocross bike at speed. And seven-year-old Layla-Rose has fallen off her bike and smashed her front teeth.

programme.title: Grand Designs: Deconstructed
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud and Greg James dish the dirt on the latest episode of Grand Designs. Has Stuart and Rosies stripy yellow box blended in with its traditional surroundings on the Wirral?

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: Paramedics treat a man in severe pain who has an umbilical hernia, and are called out to a mum who has just delivered her baby on the bathroom floor.

programme.title: Trucking Hell

programme.title: Trucking Hell

programme.title: An Saoghal Droil aig Pòl Ploc

programme.desc: St Fagans National Museum of History in Cardiff is home to more than 40 faithfully re-erected historical buildings. As a living history museum, it lives, breathes and embodies the culture and identity of Wales.

programme.title: Canal Boat Diaries
programme.desc: Autumnal fog and an overheating engine prove to be problems for narrowboater Robbie Cumming as he navigates a Roman waterway and the fast-flowing River Trent. Its a journey of many challenges as he runs aground and breaks down in Nottingham.

programme.title: The Good Life
programme.desc: Has the good life come to an end for Tom and Barbara when they come home to find their house trashed?

programme.title: Yes, Prime Minister
programme.desc: A territorial battle ensues after Sir Humphrey relocates the office of Jim Hackers political adviser.

programme.title: How the Celts Saved Britain
programme.desc: Dan Snow blows the lid on the traditional Anglo-centric view of history and reveals how the Irish saved Britain from cultural oblivion during the Dark Ages of 400-800AD. He follows in the footsteps of Irelands earliest missionaries as they venture through treacherous barbarian territory to bring literacy and technology to the future nations of Scotland and England.

programme.title: Timewatch
programme.desc: An exploration of the attempt to blow up the Houses of Parliament in 1605, one of the most famous yet least understood events in British history. It shows how the plot was almost Englands 9/11, and asks why a group of young Englishmen became so radicalised and so hell-bent on terrorism. Computer graphics recreate what the Houses of Parliament looked like in 1605, and show just how close the plotters came to success.

programme.title: The Making of King Arthur
programme.desc: Simon Armitage traces the evolution of the Arthurian legend through the literature of the medieval age and reveals that King Arthur is not the great national hero he is seen as. Hes a fickle and transitory character who was appropriated the the Normans to justify their conquest.

programme.title: Leonora Carrington: The Lost Surrealist
programme.desc: The extraordinary life of the British-Mexican artist Leonora Carrington is chronicled.

programme.desc: The team try to stop a Preston student from handing over money to scammers who have told her that they are from the UKs National Crime Agency.

programme.title: Lost and Found in the Lakes
programme.desc: The team take on one of their toughest searches for a bracelet lost in a heart-sinking moment. Social media expert Mui also attempts to return a recovered phone.

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: After 23 years living in Canada, todays buyer is returning to the UK for good. With a budget of £400,000, she is looking to make her rural escape to Devon, but theres a catch - she has never been to the county before. She need not worry because Nicki Chapman has, many times before. Away from the house search, Nicki discovers how to be a friend indeed to an exhausted bee-in-need!

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Flo and Charlie are in Twickenham to transform Micheal and Jills unloved and flowerless patch and derelict filled-in pond into a Hawaiian paradise, complete with tiki bar. They want a place to socialise, with a grand dance floor patio to boogie the night away with the local troop! Can the team achieve all of this on a £7,000 budget?

programme.title: The Inner Circle
programme.desc: Amanda Holden hosts the quiz, packed with strategy, high stakes and surprises, where players must outsmart each other to win big. Six players are each randomly assigned a secret stash of cash - anything between zero and a whopping £4,000.

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: A twist on the classic quiz show formula, contestants search through the depths of their knowledge in an attempt to score as few points as possible.

programme.title: Scam Interceptors
programme.sub-title: He Doesnt Believe Were from the BBC
programme.desc: The team encounter a group of scammers claiming to be phone giants BT. Using the cover of uploading new security software to your system, they try to gain access to your computer and then your bank account. And they have got one couple in Yorkshire on the hook. The team have their work cut out to locate the couple and convince them who to believe.

programme.title: Lost and Found in the Lakes
programme.desc: Our detectorist team take on a huge search for a long-lost family heirloom, and the scuba team dive deep in an effort to retrieve a camera chock-full of precious memories.

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Helping a young couple from the city of St Albans, Briony May Williams heads to Buckinghamshire to find a fabulous countryside escape for them and Dexter the dog. Aside from all the house hunting, Briony pays a visit to one of the countys many National Trust properties, where she finds out what it takes to be a tour guide.

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie and Lee are in Epsom to convert Jade and Jacks long, plain and unkempt garden into a sporty socialising space. Both are from avid sports-loving families. They would love a bar area to watch live football games, a place to host friends and chill, and a space to play competitive darts, football and bowls! Can the team achieve all this on a £5,000 budget?

programme.title: The Inner Circle
programme.desc: Amanda Holden hosts the quiz, packed with strategy, high stakes and surprises, where players must outsmart each other to win big. Six players are each randomly assigned a secret stash of cash - anything between zero and a whopping £4,000.

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong is joined by co-host Phil Wang for the brainy quiz where the contestants try to score as few points as possible by plumbing the depths of their general knowledge to come up with the answers no-one else could think of.

programme.title: Breakfast

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Join Gethin Jones, Helen Skelton, Michelle Ackerley and the team for conversation, advice and tips to make your day that little bit easier.

programme.title: Crimewatch Caught
programme.desc: A van driver calls 999 after making a horrific discovery and police must determine if hes telling the truth or covering a terrible crime. Plus the hunt to catch a right-wing extremist.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Dion has the same thoughts as the new owners at an end terrace in Cheshire. Martin struggles to get through the front door in Warwickshire, and Martel feels very much at home in Perthshire.

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Christina Trevanion is in Carmarthenshire, where experts Philip Serrell and Charles Hanson advise the reds and blue teams as they battle it out in Llandeilo. Christina also heads to Laugharne and visits the home of celebrated writer Dylan Thomas.

programme.title: BBC News at One
programme.desc: The latest national and international news, followed by weather.

programme.title: BBC Newsline
programme.desc: Local news from across Northern Ireland.

programme.title: BBC News at One
programme.desc: The latest national and international news, followed by weather.

programme.title: Scam Interceptors
programme.sub-title: He Doesnt Believe Were from the BBC
programme.desc: The team encounter a group of scammers claiming to be phone giants BT. Using the cover of uploading new security software to your system, they try to gain access to your computer and then your bank account. And they have got one couple in Yorkshire on the hook. The team have their work cut out to locate the couple and convince them who to believe.

programme.title: Lost and Found in the Lakes
programme.desc: Our detectorist team take on a huge search for a long-lost family heirloom, and the scuba team dive deep in an effort to retrieve a camera chock-full of precious memories.

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Helping a young couple from the city of St Albans, Briony May Williams heads to Buckinghamshire to find a fabulous countryside escape for them and Dexter the dog. Aside from all the house hunting, Briony pays a visit to one of the countys many National Trust properties, where she finds out what it takes to be a tour guide.

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie and Lee are in Epsom to convert Jade and Jacks long, plain and unkempt garden into a sporty socialising space. Both are from avid sports-loving families. They would love a bar area to watch live football games, a place to host friends and chill, and a space to play competitive darts, football and bowls! Can the team achieve all this on a £5,000 budget?

programme.title: The Inner Circle
programme.desc: Amanda Holden hosts the quiz, packed with strategy, high stakes and surprises, where players must outsmart each other to win big. Six players are each randomly assigned a secret stash of cash - anything between zero and a whopping £4,000.

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong is joined by co-host Phil Wang for the brainy quiz where the contestants try to score as few points as possible by plumbing the depths of their general knowledge to come up with the answers no-one else could think of.

programme.title: BBC News at Six
programme.desc: The latest national and international news, followed by weather.

programme.title: BBC Newsline
programme.desc: Local news from across Northern Ireland.

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Clara Amfo bring you the stories that matter from across the country.

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Zoe pleads her case, Suki turns to Lily for help, and Phil and Julie join forces to support Nigel.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Lucia revives a family portrait of a heroic sea captain, Brenton repairs a precious boxing trophy, and the team restore a Jamaican trunk that carried a musicians dreams.

programme.title: Shetland
programme.desc: The dark side of one of the most beautiful places on earth. A team of police officers and detectives uncover secrets and lies from the past in Shetland at the edge of the United Kingdom.

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: The latest national and international news, with reports from BBC correspondents worldwide.

programme.title: BBC Newsline
programme.desc: Local news from across Northern Ireland.

The celebrities in this episode include Josh Widdicombe, Chris Harris, Colin Jackson, Harriet Kelmsley, Shirley Ballas and Frankie Bridge. Jordan North and William Hanson are in the double chair.

programme.title: Reporting Scotland

programme.title: Life On the Bay
programme.desc: The Fife coast holiday park plays host to a special day as wedding supervisor Amanda makes sure that everything is perfect for the couples big day. Former taxi driver Ken keeps busy juggling several jobs at the park, including replenishing the stock in the shop, while manager Steven seems intent on depleting it. And head chef James just cant stay away from the action.

programme.title: Interior Design Masters
programme.desc: After a tough first week transforming upmarket apartments in Manchester, the remaining nine designers return to Michelles design studio on the south coast to find out about their next challenge. Welcomed by host Alan Carr, they are happy to discover that this week they are going to be able to work on their own for the first time. Michelle tells them that shes sending them to the Surrey Hills, to the fabulous Wotton House.

programme.title: Murder Case
programme.desc: In the Highland town of Elgin, detectives face a challenging investigation as they work tirelessly to uncover the truth behind Kiesha Donaghys brutal murder.

programme.title: The Ridge

programme.title: Scotcast
programme.desc: Conversation about Scotlands biggest news stories, hosted by Martin Geissler.

programme.title: David Wilsons Crime Files
programme.desc: David investigates financial crime through the story of one of Scotlands most prolific investment fraudsters: the crooked Aberdeen financial adviser Alistair Greig. Greig gained the trust of numerous people in the city, and convinced many to invest.

programme.title: Rewind 1990s
programme.desc: A journey through a year of great music, historic events and momentous news in 1990: the year Nelson Mandela is released from jail, Margaret Thatcher steps down as prime minister and Glasgow becomes the European Capital of Culture.

programme.title: Paranormal: Britains Last Witch
programme.sub-title: Britains Last Witch: Bringing Back the Dead
programme.desc: Theres only a handful of mediums worldwide who claim to do anything close to what Helen Duncan said she could and physically manifest spirits into a room. For Sian, the only way to fully understand what was happening at Helens seances is to witness this for herself, so she tracks one of these rare mediums down in the Netherlands. Sian arrives at the Dutch monastery and is greeted by a host who takes Sian on a private tour of the seance room, where the medium will work that evening.

programme.title: Paranormal: Britains Last Witch
programme.sub-title: Britains Last Witch: The Final Seance
programme.desc: Sians mission to get to the truth behind Helen Duncans apparently supernatural abilities draws to a close - but a secret package sent from Helens granddaughter in America leaves Sian with what appears to be the smoking gun she has been waiting for. The package contains what seems to be unexplainable proof that a spirit revealed the sinking of a second warship during one of Helens seances.

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: Welcome to a look at some of history?s most fearsome families. Fred Sirieix is on hand as Queen Victoria makes several trips to the Historical First Dates restaurant, in a bid to marry off her children for love, and definitely not to consolidate her empire.

programme.title: The Catch-Up
programme.desc: A round-up of the days news.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and James May embark on a trip to the British seaside in two new electric cars, taking an impromptu and thoroughly informative visit to Lincoln along the way. Meanwhile, Richard Hammond meets the worlds most extraordinary rally team and another celebrity guest hits the track in the Reasonably Priced Car. Plus, the Lamborghini Aventador flexes its muscles on the track.

programme.title: Our Girl
programme.desc: As Georgie continues to suffer from the effects of her recent kidnapping ordeal in Kenya, she throws herself into the last minute wedding plans with Jamie. However, before the big day, Georgie is given one more assignment which lands her in greater danger than ever.

programme.title: Behind Bars: Sex, Bribes and Murder
programme.desc: After a three-minute video featuring a female prison officer and an inmate having sex inside HMP Wandsworth goes viral, award-winning journalist Mobeen Azhar begins an investigation into what happened and why. A year of twists, turns and damning revelations pulls back the curtain on a dangerous wider world of coercion, corruption and contraband thriving behind bars.

programme.title: Behind Bars: Sex, Bribes and Murder
programme.desc: As Mobeens investigation deepens, it becomes clearer that illicit relationships between prisoners and jail staff are just the tip of the iceberg. The bigger story involves organised criminal gangs determined to cash in on a lucrative prison drug economy. When news breaks of a prison governor being jailed for a relationship with a drug-dealing gang boss, Mobeen becomes determined to uncover the true extent of criminal influence inside our prisons.

programme.title: Twisted Metal
programme.desc: Unexpected allegiances begin to form; Quiet gets to work; John makes amends; Sweet Tooth is ready for revenge.

programme.title: Twisted Metal

programme.title: BBC New Comedy Awards
programme.desc: Birminghams Hockley Social Club has been transformed into our very own comedy club. Taking to the stage are Eli Hart, Farhan Solo, Chloe Reynolds, Will BF and Monica Hsueh in a bid to impress our judges and book their place in the final. Award-winning comedian and writer Sarah Keyworth is here to keep the house in order. The judges are comedian, writer and podcaster Aurie Styla and local Brum stand-up Lindsey Santoro. Head judge Fatiha El-Ghorri completes the trio.

programme.title: Worzel Gummidge
programme.desc: Its the build-up to Bonfire Night, and a new face has arrived in Scatterbrook. Worzels cousin, Guy Forks, has taken his rightful place at the top of the bonfire, but an argument between the old friends leads to a competition to prove who can do the others job better. With the Bonfire Night Committee distracted, Guy convinces Worzel to swap places, but it soon becomes clear that Worzel has bitten off more than he can chew.

programme.title: The Catch-Up
programme.desc: A round-up of the days news.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May head to Italy for a supercar shootout featuring the Lamborghini Aventador, the McLaren MP4-12C and the Noble M600. Their trip starts at the incredible Nardo test track and concludes at the legendary Imola circuit. Back in the studio, the presenters look forward to some car highlights of 2012 and another top celebrity guest takes the wheel of the `Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: BBC New Comedy Awards
programme.desc: Fresh new talent aim to impress famous faces and follow in the footsteps of some of stand-ups biggest names. Across a number of rounds, comedians compete to show they could be the next breakout comedy star.

programme.title: Old School
programme.desc: Riotous campus romp in which a lawyer, having caught his wife cheating on him, sets up home near the local college, unwittingly giving his thirty-something friends an opportunity to turn his pad into a 24-hour party zone.

programme.title: Joe Swash: Forgotten Young Dads
programme.desc: Too often overlooked in research and marginalised in society, many young dads across the UK are quietly rewriting the rulebook on fatherhood. In this revealing documentary, Joe Swash, who became a first-time father in his mid-twenties, meets four young men navigating the challenges of parenting. From stigma and financial strain to isolation and emotional growth, this is the rarely seen lived experience of men in their teens and twenties entering into fatherhood.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May head to Italy for a supercar shootout featuring the Lamborghini Aventador, the McLaren MP4-12C and the Noble M600. Their trip starts at the incredible Nardo test track and concludes at the legendary Imola circuit. Back in the studio, the presenters look forward to some car highlights of 2012 and another top celebrity guest takes the wheel of the `Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: RuPauls Drag Race UK
programme.desc: RuPauls search for the UKs Next Drag Race Superstar continues.Its Rusical week! The pressure is on as the queens singing, dancing and acting skills are challenged in Peter Pansy - The Rusical. West End musical theatre legend Mazz Murray joins head judge, RuPaul, alongside Michelle Visage and Graham Norton on the judging panel as the curtain comes down on yet another queen. Which queen will be the Tinker Bell of the ball, and who will sashay away from a happy ending?

programme.title: BBC New Comedy Awards
programme.desc: The BBCs big comedy talent search, the New Comedy Awards is scouring the country to uncover the hottest new stand-ups. Ee head to the capital and the historic Alexandra Palace, home of the BBCs first broadcast. Five comics will battle it out to book their place in this years grand final showdown, where one will be crowned the BBC New Comedian of 2025. Hosting the comedy extravaganza is comedian, actor, presenter and writer Sara Pascoe.

programme.title: BBC Comedy Short Films
programme.desc: Its the year 1995, and Daves Games is a one-stop shop for all-things video games. Self-appointed gaming legend Dave is the king of his own kingdom, but theres trouble afoot as a rival shop opens just down the road.

programme.title: Behind Bars: Sex, Bribes and Murder
programme.desc: As Mobeens investigation deepens, it becomes clearer that illicit relationships between prisoners and jail staff are just the tip of the iceberg. The bigger story involves organised criminal gangs determined to cash in on a lucrative prison drug economy. When news breaks of a prison governor being jailed for a relationship with a drug-dealing gang boss, Mobeen becomes determined to uncover the true extent of criminal influence inside our prisons.

programme.title: The Celebrity Traitors: Uncloaked
programme.desc: Ed Gamble is joined once again by Series 1 Traitor Wilf and Series 3 Traitor Minah, as well as the latest murdered and banished players. Expect all the latest analysis, gossip and predictions from episode 7.

programme.title: This Is BBC TWO
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

programme.title: The Inner Circle
programme.desc: Amanda Holden hosts the quiz, packed with strategy, high stakes and surprises, where players must outsmart each other to win big. Six players are each randomly assigned a secret stash of cash - anything between zero and a whopping £4,000.

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: The presenters take the prospective buyers around to different houses in the country. The desire for more room, cleaner air and less noise drives city dwellers to seek an escape to the country.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The team restore a Man Utd shirt worn by a Busby Babe in the FA Cup final, a Bible from a wartime internment camp, an ornate Punjabi hookah and a Bradford shop window automaton.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: Twenty-four hours a day, the latest national and international stories as they break.

programme.title: Politics Live
programme.desc: Jo Coburn invites a panel of guests to share their opinions on the newsmaking stories of the day.

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Thirty players compete across the series, scoring points by answering questions correctly. However, they must avoid the impossible answers, otherwise they will be eliminated from the show until the next day.

programme.title: The Finish Line
programme.desc: Roman Kemp and sidekick Sarah Greene host the quiz show where contestants race on moving podiums across the studio floor. Correct answers get the players moving, while wrong answers will stop them in their tracks.

programme.title: Unbeatable
programme.desc: Danika, Tim, Steven and Abi battle it out to see which one of them is unbeatable.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.sub-title: North East England and Yorkshire: Judging
programme.desc: Its judging day, and only one chef can go through to represent north east England and Yorkshire. historian Greg Jenner helps decide the winner from the two remaining chefs.

programme.title: Big Cats
programme.desc: Following the nocturnal pursuits of the tiny black-footed cat in South Africa that stakes its claim to the title of the worlds deadliest, and in remotest Mongolia the rarely seen Pallass cat is at home with her kittens. Finally, in the Karoo of South Africa, the serval thrives amongst the futuristic landscape of Africas biggest industrial complex.

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Paul Martin is joined by experts Adam Partridge and Philip Serrell at classical mansion Ickworth House in Suffolk. Adam discusses the merits of stretchy swimsuits, and Philip gets a lovely surprise at the auction with an East India Company medal.

programme.title: Richard Osmans House of Games
programme.desc: Every day this week, celebrity contestants Krishnan Guru-Murthy, Megan McCubbin, Ashley Storrie and Adam Woodyatt take on a series of quiz rounds selected by the host, quiz legend Richard Osman. A daily winner is declared following a quickfire round at the end of each show, and the scores are tallied across the week, resulting in an overall champion being crowned on Friday.

programme.title: Strictly Come Dancing: It Takes Two
programme.desc: Fleur East is on hand with all the backstage news and behind-the-scenes action from the world of Strictly Come Dancing. And Choreography Corner is back to dissect the rest of the weekends Halloween performances.

programme.title: Jules and Gregs Wild Swim
programme.desc: Jules and Greg plunge into the freezing northern waters of Shetland for their coldest swim yet. Greg channels his inner Viking, and then our intrepid couple unwind in a homemade wood burning sauna on the edge of Northern Europe.

programme.title: Mary at 90: A Lifetime of Cooking
programme.desc: Sports broadcaster Gabby Logan joins Dame Mary in the kitchen to cook some of her standout time-saving recipes. Gabby asks Mary to share her own tales of being a working mum 50 years ago - the early days when Mary was one of the first TV cooks. Gabby is keen to cook, and she has come to the right place, because from the start of her career, the core of Marys focus has been helping busy, working families with simple dishes for when time is short.

programme.title: Digging for Britain
programme.desc: In the west of Britain, theres one of the largest Roman buildings ever discovered in Britain, an Iron Age chariot is saved, and evidence is found of the transatlantic slave trade in Devon.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Sandi and Alan take a look at some weaponry with Nish Kumar, Lou Sanders and Roisin Conaty.

programme.title: Worlds Most Dangerous Roads
programme.desc: Comedian and certified indoorsman Phil Wang convinces best friend and fellow comic Piere Novelle to join him in Africas Kingdom in the Sky. Together they traverse some of Lesothos trickiest tracks.

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Featuring extensive coverage of the days top national and international news stories, along with explanations about the context and potential aftereffects.

programme.title: BBC Weather
programme.desc: The latest weather forecast.

programme.title: Highland Cops
programme.desc: A team of police travel to the Outer Hebrides to search through the snow for a missing 16-year-old. In Shetland, the cops have to deal with Viking revellers and a drunk driver.

programme.title: The Celebrity Traitors
programme.desc: As the game nears the end, the murders become increasingly harder for the Traitors, and time is running out to increase the final prize pot.

programme.title: The Celebrity Traitors: Uncloaked
programme.desc: Ed Gamble is joined by Series 3 winner Jake, and the two of them are accompanied on the sofa by the latest banished and murdered players from the game.

programme.desc: The human story of space exploration. Personal accounts from astronauts and scientists, covering key milestones, global space rivalries and the future of humanity beyond Earth.

programme.title: Dosh
programme.desc: Vikram Chopra is shocked to get the news that his only son, Gaurav, has met with a sudden death. Police conclude that his death was a homicide, and assign Inspector Om to investigate this incident.

programme.title: Kachcha Chor
programme.desc: A criminal joins an NGO that looks at societal reform on the behest of a social worker. This brings about changes in his behaviour and attitude.

programme.title: Jai Vikraanta
programme.desc: When Choudhary Amar Singh is killed because of the money he owes a cruel landowner, his son decides to avenge him.

programme.title: Deewaar
programme.desc: Two brothers who have grown up on different sides of the law find themselves headed for a showdown in modern-day India.

programme.title: OMG Oh My God
programme.desc: Kanjibhai tries to take down God after his shop is destroyed in an earthquake.

programme.title: Bhaag Milkha Bhaag
programme.desc: This is a true story of `the Flying Sikh - world champion runner and Olympian Milkha Singh who overcame the massacre of his family and the civil war during the India-Pakistan partition.

programme.title: Dasvi
programme.desc: Jailed under a tough cop, an uneducated politician decides to spend his time studying for high school, while his scheming wife has plans of her own.

programme.title: Dushmani
programme.desc: A young woman is parted from her lover and forced to marry an underworld don. She hopes her lover will save her, but when their families become rivals, he turns against her.

programme.title: Dove
programme.desc: Anoop and Aditi love each other but face an unexpected obstacle when Anoop gets charged with murder. Meanwhile, Kumar and Sona, who share an intimate relationship, try to overcome their challenges.

programme.title: Hanste Khelte
programme.desc: Family drama following the lives of a group of college students.

programme.title: Jurmana
programme.desc: A notorious ladys man makes a bet with an old college friend that he will date their ex-professors daughter.

programme.title: Kaalia
programme.desc: A young man becomes obsessed with avenging the deaths of his family.

programme.title: De Dana Dan
programme.desc: Singapore-based Nitin Bankars education was paid for by his employer, Kuljeet Kaur, and he, after the passing of his father, works as an unpaid maid-chauffeur for her until such time he pays off whatever she had spent.

programme.title: Shershaah
programme.desc: The life of Indian army captain Vikram Batra, awarded with the Param Vir Chakra, Indias highest award for valour for his actions during the 1999 Kargil War.

programme.title: Gair Kaanooni
programme.desc: When police officer Kapil Khanna discovers that his son was abducted at birth, and switched with a girl, he spends the next 20 years trying to track down his missing son, and finally finds him living with his enemy.

programme.title: Rudaali
programme.desc: Sanichari is a rudaali, a professional mourner. After her husband dies, she joins a tribe of bonded labourers. Despite being buffeted about by a male-dominated society, Sanichari has never cried. A seasoned rudaali, Bhinkni, enters her life and suggests that Sanichari learns the tricks of the trade.

programme.title: Kanku - Rang Parko
programme.desc: Working as a maid at her foster home, Kankus life takes a turn when she becomes the daughter-in-law of the same house, and thus begins a tough journey!

programme.title: Rangai Jaane Rangma
programme.desc: Two ambitious young women lead very different lives due to the colour of their skin, which influences their career paths, how they get treated by society, and even who they fall in love with.

programme.title: Rasoi Show
programme.desc: Invited guests prepare a wide range of vegetarian dishes from around the world and share interesting recipes and cooking techniques.

programme.title: Radha Krishna
programme.desc: A furious Vrishabhanu accuses Nandan of conspiring against him and using Radha as bait. Jatila questions Krishna about his love for Radha in the presence of their parents and villagers.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Rachel must hire an assistant and agonises over whether to hire an efficient, experienced woman, or sexy young Tag Jones. Ignoring her friends advice, she hires Tag and soon regrets it. To make matters worse, Tag is attracted to Phoebe.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With the Engagement Picture
programme.desc: While taking an engagement picture for himself and Monica, Chandler cant stop pulling a strange face, Rachel enlists Joey to take Tag out for a night on the town, and Phoebe and Ross date a couple in the middle of a divorce.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With the Nap Partners
programme.desc: Wedding fever continues when Monica cant decide whether to appoint Rachel or Phoebe as her maid of honour. To help Monica decide, Joey and Ross test them on how they would react in certain wedding situations.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With Rosss Library Book
programme.desc: Ross is elated that the university library contains his doctoral dissertation, but he is shocked to discover that it is located in a remote corner frequently used by students having sex. Elsewhere, the tables are turned on Joey when Erin is the one to just want sex and not a relationship.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where Chandler Doesnt Like Dogs
programme.desc: Joey may have ruined Rachels chances with Tag when he opens his mouth during Thanksgiving dinner, and Phoebe reveals that she has been secretly keeping a cute dog in her room for a few days while its owner is away.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With All the Candy
programme.desc: Rachel is dating her assistant, Tag, but they must keep it a secret at work because of the companys anti-dating policy. Her friends warn her that the relationship will only cause her trouble, but just for fun, she becomes more brazen about it.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With the Holiday Armadillo

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With All the Cheesecakes

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where Theyre Up All Night
programme.desc: During their fist night together, Rachel and Tag realise they forgot to ship out an important package at the office.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Phoebes new job as a telemarketer gets off to a tricky start when the first person she calls, an office worker called Earl, tells her he feels unappreciated and wants to kill himself. Phoebe keeps him on the telephone, trying to persuade him otherwise and finally takes the desperate measure of going to his office to convince him to stay alive.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where They All Turn Thirty
programme.desc: Celebrating Rachels 30th birthday inspires the friends to reminisce about their own 30th birthdays. Joey got angry with God for breaking their deal, Ross bought himself a sports car in an attempt to recapture his youth, and Monica got blind drunk and embarrassed herself at her surprise party.

programme.title: Little Nicky
programme.desc: After considering retirement, Satan decides to hang on for another 10,000 years, angering his older sons and heirs. They decamp to New York and seal Hell shut, but without a regular supply of souls, Satan could literally evaporate into thin air. His only hope lies in his nerdy youngest son, but even with the help of Valerie and a talking dog, hes going to have problems persuading his bigger brothers to return to Hell.

programme.title: Dara OBriain: Voice of Reason
programme.desc: The exclusive opportunity to see Dara O Briains globe trotting Voice of Reason live show. Filmed exclusively for the BBC at Londons world famous Eventim Apollo. Dara is one of the most recognisable faces on British TV as host of long running satirical show Mock the Week, Stargazing Live, Robot Wars and Blockbusters. With Voice of Reason, Dara goes back to his day job as a world class stand-up comedian.

programme.title: Murder at the Motel

programme.desc: Detectives in major cities in the United States race against the clock in the wake of homicides, knowing that if they dont find a lead within the first 48 hours, their chances of solving a case are cut in half.

programme.title: Homicide Hunter
programme.desc: Lt Joe Kenda spent 23 years in the Colorado Springs Police Department where he amassed a lifetime of memories catching killers and helping solve close to 400 homicide investigations.

programme.title: Homicide Hunter
programme.desc: A son of a prominent politician is murdered. Kenda must sort through a list of suspects.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.sub-title: Natalie V Jane, Lauren V Sianna
programme.desc: Criminal barrister Robert Rinder rules on real-life cases.

programme.title: Murder at the Motel

programme.title: Motive to Murder
programme.desc: A psychological look at some of the real-life murder cases that made headlines around the world.

programme.title: Motive to Murder
programme.desc: When a distinguished Navy doctor and his wife are founded stabbed inside their San Diego home, police launch a hunt for a brutal killer.

programme.title: Meet, Marry, Murder
programme.desc: Chacey Poynter saw men as tools to get what she wanted. Her husband Bob offered stability and money. Her boyfriends offered a way to get rid of Bob.

programme.title: Accident, Suicide, or Murder
programme.desc: A well-known rock climber is found dead at the bottom of a cliff, shocking his family and the local climbing community. But a closer look reveals more sinister details, and dedicated investigators must determine the tragic truth.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.sub-title: Atul V Terry, Austin V Corey
programme.desc: Small claims cases are adjudicated in a studio courtroom by criminal law barrister Rob Rinder. He questions claimants and defendants before making his final judgements.

programme.title: 999 Killer on the Line
programme.desc: A look at the story of Merseyside resident Christopher Strettle. In an attempt to avoid facing justice, Strettle spun a web of lies to the police after murdering his friend by shooting him in the chest.

programme.title: Killer Britain With Dermot Murnaghan
programme.desc: Pawel Relowicz: The story of Libby Squire, who hit headlines when she went missing in 2021. Her path crossed with 26-year-old Relowicz, who cruelly took her life. (S4, ep 3)

programme.title: Cops Who Kill With Will Mellor
programme.desc: Will Mellor and a team of experts delve into the case of Steven Jones, who tried to use his police knowledge to get away with the murder of his wife Madallin.

programme.desc: Delving into the stories of killers who broke the Hippocratic Oath to use their medical knowledge for murder, taking the lives of often vulnerable victims instead of caring for them.

programme.desc: The Black Dog Salvage crew take on a foursquare farmhouse in Roanoke, Virginia.

programme.title: Homestead Rescue
programme.desc: After Hurricane Helene obliterates a 100-year-old farmhouse in NC, a once self-sufficient family is left with nothing. The Raneys face their most urgent mission yet: to rebuild a fourth-generation homestead, making it 100% self-sustainable.

programme.title: Homestead Rescue
programme.desc: Virginia homesteaders are on the brink after the unexplained disappearance of their water and food sources. The Raneys race to solve these mysteries, creatively revamping their infrastructure to give them the confidence to complete their dream cabin.

programme.title: Gold Rush
programme.desc: The boys are back in Alaska (although Discovery dropped the states mention in the title after the first season) hoping to strike it rich mining for gold. Their first effort was anything but rich and glorious, however, as the crew led by Todd Hoffman and his father, Jack, sunk $250,000 into their dream and came away with just $20,000 worth of gold. The dismal summer was filled with injuries, malfunctioning equipment and constant fighting among the greenhorn miners, yet their serious case of gold fever trumps any talk of giving up and leads to a new operating plan in order to salvage their dream. The series also keeps tabs on the efforts of teenager Parker Schnabel and old-timer Dakota Fred to hit the mother lode at separate sites.

programme.title: Gold Divers
programme.sub-title: Gold Can Mend a Broken Heart: Part 1
programme.desc: Last-minute hopes hang in the balance. Shawn follows old mining evidence, while Kris suffers a catastrophic failure on the All In that threatens to end both his season and mining career.

programme.title: Gold Divers
programme.sub-title: Gold Can Mend a Broken Heart: Part 2
programme.desc: Last-minute hopes hang in the balance. Shawn follows old mining evidence, while Kris suffers a catastrophic failure on the All In that threatens to end both his season and mining career.

programme.title: Moonshiners
programme.desc: Tickles crew resurrects a 400-mile bootleg route from the 1980s, but a shine spill puts them face-to-face with the law. Richard attempts a risky liquor that uses mould to aid in fermentation. Tim turns to honey to get his shine sales buzzing.

programme.title: Marooned With Ed Stafford
programme.desc: Adventurer Ed Stafford has walked the length of the Amazon River - he is the first person to accomplish that - and survived alone for 60 days on a desert island near Fiji (a feat chronicled in `Naked Castaway), so perhaps the challenges presented in `Marooned arent that daunting. Filmed in Venezuelas Gran Sabana mountains, Botswanas Okavango Delta, Romanias Carpathian Mountains, the Western Australia coast, and Borneos Brunei jungles, the five hourlong episodes see Stafford - a former British Army captain - attempt to last ten days in the harsh environments with nothing more than a camera. Viewers are provided a fly-on-the-wall perspective as Ed tries to find food, make fire, process water to drink, and build a shelter - among many other life-saving challenges.

programme.title: Homestead Rescue
programme.desc: An extended family of homesteaders are on the brink of disintegration in Texas, crowded with their animals on a sliver of their land. To overcome the rift between the homesteaders and the homestead itself, the Raneys must execute an epic overhaul.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: The 1982 Porsche 911 SC: the `SC stands for Super Carrera, and is apt for this particular classic. The 911 story started in 1964, when the current owner was born: a local car dealer going by the name of Mike Brewer.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: A client wants a German half-track armoured personnel carrier converted into a Pioneer variant, used by the German army during the Battle of the Bulge.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers World Tour
programme.desc: Mike and Elvis are going global. This time, the stakes are higher, the deadlines tighter and the motor transformations are more jaw-dropping than ever.

programme.title: Bitchin Rides: Road to the Ridler
programme.desc: Dave agonises over the colour choice for the Ridler build. The previous five winners were all yellow, but Dave decides to go in another direction.

programme.title: How the Universe Works
programme.desc: Exploring how an apocalyptic planetary collision, millions of cosmic strikes, and a supernova created Earth, and if life exists on similarly created planets throughout the universe.

Sheldon and Amy host a brunch at Pennys flat and, prompted by stress about the babys arrival, Howard makes an impulsive purchase.

programme.title: Taskmaster Bleeped

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts with Rachel Riley and Susie Dent. Sean Lock and Paul Foot take on Jon Richardson and Angela Barnes. John Cooper Clarke joins Dictionary Corner.

programme.title: Friday Night Dinner
programme.desc: Its Christmas day and Mum has made a fantastic Christmas dinner, although Adam is, as usual, a bit confused. The boys are delighted that Grandma is coming round, but horrified that Dads mother is coming too.

programme.title: Friday Night Dinner

programme.title: Modern Family

programme.title: The Simpsons

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Physicists and best friends Leonard and Sheldon learn about the social aspects of life through their relationships with the free-spirited beauty who moves in next door.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: When their academic competitors charm America on a publicity tour, Sheldon and Amy try to get some Nobel laureates on their side.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Amy has a meltdown when she feels the pressure of what it would mean for women everywhere if she were to win a Nobel Prize. Koothrappali and Wolowitz try to relive the old days after Wolowitz buys a scooter that looks like the one he had years ago.

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Billy Corkhill finds that Hollyoaks has much in common with Brookside Close. With the hospital on intruder alert, heartbreak follows in the mortuary, and a confession takes a shocking turn.

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Donnys world is shattered by a shocking revelation. Leela offers kindness to another resident in the wake of the plane crash. And in hospital, a new mother continues to spiral.

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon heads to Pantaleones in Denver, Colorado, where he meets the Italian restaurants owner Pete, who is truly stuck in the past. Pete stubbornly maintains that he makes the `Best Pizza in Denver, based on a review from the 1980s.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

programme.title: Modern Family

programme.title: Modern Family

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Everyone focuses on making sure all the arrangements for Amy and Sheldons big day go according to plan - except the bride and groom.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: Stop or My Dog Will Shoot

programme.desc: Eight bakers of Bake Off past return to the tent to compete once more. The bakers face three festive challenges, starting with the signature challenge. Paul and Mary want them to make some highly decorative Christmas bakes that require intricate icing.

programme.title: Jamies Cracking Christmas
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver demonstrates how to wow friends and families with amazing recipes to raise your Christmas spread to the next level. In this episode he cooks roast goose with all the trimmings.

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers Home for Christmas
programme.sub-title: Rev Kate Bottley / The Big Day
programme.desc: The Bikers cook up a cherry and bourbon glazed gammon, rolled and stuffed turkey breast and legs plus a magnificent Christmas croquembouche - a fabulous centrepiece dessert - as they get to know how Kate spends her Christmas.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: This trip Guys chasing down the holiday meal every which way. In Portland, Maine, we visit a family-run joint where stuffed turkey and stuffed lobster are Thanksgiving traditions.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy looks for turkey dinners.

programme.title: Holiday Baking Championship
programme.desc: The seven remaining bakers make baked brie and jam mini pies. Later, they use a prepared ingredient to make a crowd-pleasing Thanksgiving dessert.

programme.title: Christmas Cookie Challenge
programme.desc: The five talented cookie makers must make a super-sized decorated cookie for Santa, plus some tiny decorated cookies for his elves. Then, with $10,000 on the line, the bakers must create a 3D winter wonderland scene using cookies.

programme.title: Cake Wars
programme.sub-title: Christmas: Whos Coming Down the Chimney?
programme.desc: The six remaining teams tackle ugly Christmas sweaters and imagine who comes down the chimney when Santa is sick.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree invites friends and family for a festive holiday get-together. Ree makes canapes including beef tenderloin sandwiches, holiday rollups, shrimp pineapple skewers, tortellini skewers, queso, smoked sausage in barbecue sauce and, peppermint fudge.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Its a few days before Christmas, and Ree is making Christmas goodies to give as gifts. She whips up homemade gumdrops, Christmas cherries, pretzel turtles, cayenne cheese straws and sweet spicy smoky roasted almonds.

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers: Mums Know Best
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers are on the search for the most interesting food that Britains mums are cooking for their families this Christmas. Si and Dave tour the nation hunting out Britains festive favourites and a few surprises. On their journey they find mums cooking everything from roast goose with all the trimmings to Pinnekjott and from festive gingerbread to Christmassy coconut samosas.

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers Home for Christmas
programme.desc: The bikers have the solution to those days between Christmas and New Year: a Bang Bang turkey salad, figs stuffed with stilton and a chestnut and chocolate roulade with Christmas pudding parfait. Plus, they find out how Alex spends her Christmas.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: A shoulder pull and a holiday ham; Mexican tamales and quinoa sweet potato tacos.

programme.title: Guys Ranch Kitchen
programme.desc: Guy Fieri hosts some of his best chef friends at the ranch to cook up yuletide cheer with their favourite holiday dishes.

programme.title: Holiday Baking Championship
programme.desc: The six bakers are tasked with reinventing panettone. Then theyre challenged to create a decorated cupcake mosaic inspired by a pair of holiday pyjamas.

programme.title: Christmas Cookie Challenge
programme.desc: Host Eddie Jackson recruits five cookie makers to make decorated cookie toys in the first round. In the display round, the remaining bakers make edible cookie boxes to fill with Christmas cookies for a chance at the $10,000 prize.

programme.title: Cake Wars
programme.desc: The five remaining teams must make a delicious food display depicting what Santa might use when his sleigh breaks down.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Its main course day, the half-way point in Finals Week, and those chefs who have yet to get a dish on the shortlist are feeling the heat. With only dishes judged to be perfect in with a chance at reaching the WI banquet, the standards are higher than ever before.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Its a battle for dessert, and the last chance for the 8 regional champions to get a dish in contention for the final banquet. Those whove failed to make the judges shortlist so far are going all out. Joining the judges is author of the WI centenary cookbook Mary Gwynn.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The banquet is finally here. Its the culmination of months of hard work as the winning chefs strive to plate up perfect dishes for the ladies of the Womens Institute, at Londons historic Drapers Hall where pioneers of the WI once gathered.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Three top chefs from Scotland are out to impress this weeks veteran judge and be crowned Scottish champion. Adam Handling has already won a number of industry awards and is full of confidence. His starter sets out to take the diner on a tour of the UKs best producers. Hes up against Michael Bremner, who is hoping to impress with contemporary ingredients including Birch sap and Douglas fir oil. Ally McGrath is celebrating his nations finest produce and making his very own version of haggis.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Three newcomers to the competition create their fish dishes in a bid to be crowned Scottish champion. The standard is so high the veteran judge is moved to tears.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Ally McGrath has been keeping the veteran judge entertained with his very individual approach. Also, the highly competitive Adam Handling has been showcasing the finest produce grown and caught in and around the UK in his menu. Once again Michael Bremner is out to show how inventive he can be.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: One chef will go home and today the veteran judge finds himself with a difficult decision to make. Inventive Chef Michael Bremner is recreating the Scottish deserts of his childhood, Adam Handling is sticking with his trademark Asian flavours and Ally McGrath is tempering chocolate for the very first time.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Scotlands two highest scoring chefs are cooking for judges for the very first time. Both chefs have decided to make changes to some of their dishes, taking on board criticisms made during the week by the veteran judge.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Chef Josh Eggleton is back for a third time. Last year he made the national finals when his starter was shortlisted for the banquet, this year he intends to go one step further and cook at the banquet. One of his rivals last time, Jude Kereama is also back and out to do better than he did previously. The third competitor is newcomer Chris Wheeler who is originally from Swanage in Dorset.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: There are some exciting dishes on the menu as the three chefs from the South West tackle the fish course. Chef Josh Eggleton is hoping to impress with an original take on Bolognese, just one of six elements on his complex fish dish.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the main course and Chef Chris Wheeler is out to show just how theatrical he can be, his ideas are surprising everyone in the kitchen. No one knows quite what to expect and the veteran chef is hoping it tastes as good as it looks.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the dessert course and it is Josh Eggleton who has come up with the most ambitious dessert. He is creating his own self-serve ice cream made from vegetables, he is making everything from scratch including toppings and syrups.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the head to head and the South West regions two highest scoring chefs are cooking for judges Oliver Peyton, Prue Leith and Matthew Fort. They are joined by guest judge, journalist and restaurant critic, Grace Dent.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Two newcomers to the competition are challenging reigning North West champion Matt Worswick. Adam Reid is Head Chef for one of the UKs leading culinary talents, and Kim Woodward who made history when she was appointed Head Chef at the Savoy Grill.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the fish course and reigning North West champion Matt Worswick has reason to be confident. However, Kims confident she has got one up on Matt by baking her own black bread unlike Matt whos taking a shortcut.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the main course of the North West Regional heat and the scores mean this is a crucial round. Matt Worswick may be the reigning champion but he is not yet assured of a place cooking for the judges and he is feeling the strain.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Its the dessert course and the three North West competitors are getting creative, producing some of the most original and stunning desserts. All three chefs are working in a hot kitchen, the tension is palpable, and this time one chef will go home.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two chefs are cooking for judges Matthew Fort, Prue Leith and Oliver Peyton, and guest judge Lady Claire MacDonald OBE. There are stand out dishes from both chefs making it a difficult contest to judge.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Three of the finest chefs from Wales are competing to be crowned champion. Two chefs are back for a second time: Phil Carmichael, from Cowbridge, South Wales, is Executive Chef at Berners Tavern in London and Adam Bannister, is chef and co-owner of Slice in his home city of Swansea. Adam was crowed Welsh champion last year so this year Phil is back with something to prove. He plans to go home raising the flag for Wales. The third chef is newcomer Andrew Birch, also from Swansea.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the fish course and newcomer Andrew Birch is confident, he is passionate about seafood. He is celebrating the cockle which is harvested near his home city of Swansea. Adam Bannister has created an alter ego, Captain Bannister for his modern take on the old boil in the bag fish dinners and Phil has chosen to revamp the classic prawn cocktail.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Phil Carmichael is serving up his version of an OBE, a refined take on onions, bacon and egg. Adam is planning to serve up Wild boar on a spit, while Andrew turns up the heat when he combines strong Japanese flavours with a traditional roast.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the dessert course and one chef will go home. Phil Carmichael is determined it wont be him but not everything is going to plan when he tackles his Cup of Tea for Maam. One of the accompaniments to his earl grey panna cotta just wont work. He has to make a difficult decision.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the head to head. The two highest scoring chefs from Wales are cooking for judges Oliver Peyton, Prue Leith and Matthew Fort who are joined by guest judge, blogger and food writer Rosie Birkett.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Three newcomers are competing to become regional champion. Daniel Smith, a former head chef for the Roux brothers, now runs his own restaurant in his beloved home county of Norfolk. Andrew Scotts worked with the best in the business, and hes concentrating on telling powerful stories as well as delivering perfect flavours. Danny Gill is a former head chef at Daniel Cliffords two star restaurant Midsummer House.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the fish course and the chefs are using some of the UKs best seafood: lobster, salmon and Cornish crab. Danny Gill is a chef who likes to use the very latest equipment to create the most intense flavours. Hes going to great lengths to maximise the taste of his cucumber consomme and it is causing a lot of interest in the kitchen.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Two chefs are cooking venison. Danny Gill is making a venison wellington, inspired by his Dad, a former RAF chef who has served up Wellington for royalty at many air force banquets. While Andrew Scott has sourced his venison from the Queens Scottish estate, Balmoral.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: This week three chefs from the central region are fighting to be crowned champion. One competitor will go home, only the two highest scoring chefs will make it through to the judging chamber. Danny Gill is facing his toughest day yet, choosing to make a staggering eight elements for his imaginative dessert.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The Central regions two highest scoring chefs are cooking for judges Oliver Peyton, Prue Leith and Matthew Fort, for the very first time. Joining them in the chamber is guest judge Enam Ali MBE, a food entrepreneur who set up The British Curry Awards.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Three of the most exciting talents from London and the South East region are competing for a place in the National Finals. Head chef Mark Froydenlund runs Marcus Wareings two star restaurant. Russell Bateman is head Chef at The Grove in Hertfordshire and Ronnie Murray who heads up the Hix Restaurant group.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the fish course and chef Russell Bateman is celebrating the diversity of his beloved home town of London - by combining lobster with jerk spices for an ambitious fish course with seven key elements. Ronnie Murrays taking a risk with an ingredient which is close to the veteran judges heart...and is planning to serve it at three different temperatures warm, deep fried and frozen. And two Michelin starred Mark Froydenlund is planning a novel way to present his dish.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Its the all-important main course and returning contender Mark Froydenlund is banking on it being his strongest dish. Russell Bateman is creating a beef dish, and Ronnie Murrays mixing a crown of lamb with a curried filling.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Its the dessert course and the final chance for three of London and South Easts most competitive and talented chefs to get through to the judging chamber, today the veteran judge will send one chef home.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the head to head and the two highest scoring chefs from the London and South East region are cooking for judges Oliver Peyton, Prue Leith and Matthew Fort. Joining this week as guest judge is Kevin Gould, an award winning food writer.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Mini Patel is back for a second attempt at the north east regional title but he is competing against two young newcomers, Tommy Banks and Chris Archer. Last year, Mini went home after the dessert course, so he is hoping to keep better control of his nerves this year.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the fish course and two chefs, Tommy and Mini, have very similar ingredients - both are cooking mackerel. But Mini is trying an original beetroot sorbet while Tommy is using wild woodruff and oyster leaf from his own garden. Chris Archer has chosen the king of the sea, turbot, but there is controversy in the kitchen.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the main course of the north east region and overnight there has been a dramatic development. It is a tough and emotional day for the chefs as they react to the news but they battle on in a bid to present a perfect dish with venison and wagyu-angus beef - the meat of the day.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is a highly emotional day for one of the chefs as he prepares a dish which is inspired by and a tribute to his own great Briton, his late grandfather. But all is not going to plan and the chef ends up making one key element three times in a bid to achieve perfection.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two chefs are cooking for judges Matthew Fort, Prue Leith and Oliver Peyton for the very first time. Joining them as guest judge is John Williams MBE, the executive head chef at The Ritz, the only hotel to hold a royal warrant for banqueting.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is Chris McGowans third time however, he is facing tough competition from Mark Abbott, head chef at Daniel Cliffords 2 Michelin star restaurant, Midsummer House, and also from Eddie Attwell who has just completed a year as head chef at Ardtara Country House in Upperlands.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Mark Abbott is pushing himself again plating up a complex fish course of the very finest produce. He is calling it Shellsational but at the last minute he forgets a key element. Returning chef Chris McGowan is refining cod and chips and Eddie Attwell is getting classical with the king of the sea, turbot.The repartee is relentless as the chefs jostle for top place on the leader board. Once again there is plenty of emotion as the veteran chef delivers the scores.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the main course and returning Chef Chris McGowan is feeling confident but part of his dish involves making his own venison sausages to serve with a venison rack, and getting it all done in time is straining his emotions. Eddie Attwell is also serving the meat but with a traditional Northern Irish dish called Dock pudding. Mark Abbott is pushing himself again, he is using wagyu beef and serving it with tongue and corn cooked in a variety of ways.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The three chefs from Northern Ireland are cooking their desserts and one chef is on course for a historic score, he could beat his boss - a veteran of GBM - and achieve more marks than anyone has done throughout the history of the competition.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The three chefs from Northern Ireland are cooking their desserts and one chef is on course for a historic score, he could beat his boss - a veteran of GBM - and achieve more marks than anyone has done throughout the history of the competition.

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Sonali Shah is on a house hunting mission in the Forest of Dean helping a couple with a £500,000 budget find a perfect country home that meets their specific demands for the garden. While in the area, Sonali visits Ragmans Lane Farm and discovers how market gardening produces not just organic food, but is also a financial leg-up for small-scale vegetable growers trying to break into the farming industry.

programme.title: Home Town
programme.desc: Ben and Erin help a newly-wed couple who recently moved to Mississippi. The couples wish list includes a banquette, a master bedroom and a spacious front porch.

programme.title: Renovation Aloha
programme.desc: After a year-long wait, Kamohai and Tristyn face a never-ending nightmare after squatters have taken over a property in Waipahu, causing chaos and delays. With a freeway nearby, Tristyn also faces the challenge of designing soundproofing solutions.

programme.title: Home Town
programme.desc: A woman moving back to Laurel wants a place big enough to accommodate her parents, kids and grandkids if they visit all at once; Erin cant wait to deliver on her ideal design plan: blue and white in the French provincial style.

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Another British couple decide to swap the grey skies of Britain for sun, sea and sand abroad.

programme.title: Building Alaska
programme.desc: Mike and Kathleen begin on the foundation, but their nail gun goes on the fritz and the posts arent level; dog mushers Paige and Cody run low on supplies; Mike and Teresa work on their foundation with a damaged excavator.

programme.title: Flip or Flop
programme.desc: Tarek and Christina get a lead on a home in Fullerton, CA, which seems too good to be true. Upon arrival they see the house is riddled with cracks, but even with foundation repairs it should be a good flip for them.

programme.title: Flip or Flop
programme.desc: Tarek is contacted by his friend Pete DeBest, who wants to go 50/50 on a great deal on a house in La Habra, CA. With Christina busy with the baby Brayden, Tarek will team up with Pete to tackle this flip.

programme.title: My Lottery Dream Home International
programme.desc: After winning the lottery, a couple from Essex have £600,000 to spend on their dream home; their wish list includes a large kitchen and a spacious garden.

programme.title: Inside the Mind of Vladimir Putin
Farewell Israel: Bush, Iran and the Revolt of Islam
programme.desc: Filmmaker and Islamic history expert Joel Gilbert explores the history of the Muslim religion.

programme.title: M.A.D. World
programme.desc: For four decades two global superpowers face off, poised for swift and terrible action. It is an arms race, a propaganda battle and a deadly game. It is the Cold War.

programme.title: M.A.D. World
programme.desc: As the arms race rages on, the 1950s become a decade of paranoia. The threat of mutually assured destruction maintains the stalemate between democracy and communism.

programme.title: M.A.D. World
programme.desc: Russia seals itself behind an Iron Curtain, spawning the birth of revolutions across East Europe as the bitter rivalry between capitalism and communism rages from Berlin to Havana and all the way to Outer Space.

programme.title: M.A.D. World
programme.desc: The stakes couldnt be higher in the 60s as the USSR places nuclear warheads in Cuba, the first US troops arrive in Vietnam, and the world witnesses the moon landing.

programme.title: Murge: The Cold War Front
programme.desc: Exploring a perceived threat from America: the stationing of nuclear weapons in Murge, Italy.

programme.title: Pillars of Faith

programme.title: A Tudor Wonder: Hardwick Hall
programme.desc: Film explores Bess of Hardwicks life, with Suzannah Lipscomb touring her grand Tudor home and art.

programme.title: Hans Holbein The Younger
programme.desc: Holbeins Tudor portraits with experts who reveal the secrets behind his iconic masterpieces.

programme.title: Margaret Beaufort: Mother of the Tudors

programme.title: Medieval Pleasures
programme.desc: In this episode, Eleanor and Dr Kate Lister take to the streets of York, then to the Tower of London to uncover the sex lives of folks living in these places over 500 years ago.

programme.title: The Worst Jobs in History

programme.title: Medieval Kings: Henry VII
programme.desc: A biography on each of the Medieval Kings.

programme.title: Henry VIII - The Tudor Tyrant
programme.desc: The life and legacy of Tudor king Henry VIII who was born in 1491.

programme.title: World War II in Colour
programme.desc: In the run-up to September 1939, political and economic chaos in the aftermath of World War I allowed Hitler in Germany, Mussolini in Italy and ultra-nationalists in imperial Japan to seize absolute power.

programme.title: World War II in Colour
programme.desc: Germany took just four weeks to conquer Poland, using a new form of warfare - Blitzkrieg. Six armoured tank units known as Panzer divisions, supported by the Luftwaffe, quickly broke through Polish defences.

programme.title: Margaret Beaufort: Mother of the Tudors
