programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: After seizing power in 1933, Adolf Hitler began systematically transforming a peaceful German population into a ruthless war machine. Experts investigate the innovative methods used by the Nazis to indoctrinate and control the will of its citizens.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.sub-title: The Secrets Of The Devils Bible
programme.desc: "The Codex Gigas," also known as the "Devils Bible," is a giant medieval tome that has evoked fear for centuries and believed to contain a malevolent power. Experts investigate its legendary secrets and uncover the mystery behind its author.

programme.title: River Hunters
programme.desc: US YouTube sensation Beau Ouimette and presenter Rick Edwards visit a range of historically significant sites in search of incredible archaeological finds.

programme.title: Britains Most Historic Towns
programme.desc: Professor Alice Roberts tells the story of Roman Britain by studying the history of Chester, Britains most Roman town.

programme.title: Britains Most Historic Towns
programme.desc: Professor Alice Roberts explores British history through the stories of individual towns and examines Britain in wartime by looking at the coastal town of Dover.

programme.title: Britains Most Historic Towns
programme.desc: In Belfast, the UKs most Victorian city, Alice Roberts visits the shipyards that built the Titanic, gets locked up in the Crumlin Road gaol and learns about 19th-century etiquette.

programme.title: Craig Charles: UFO Conspiracies
programme.desc: Long-time UFO enthusiast Craig Charles and astrophysicist Sarah Cruddas scrutinise compelling evidence relating to some of the most perplexing UFO encounters of recent years, revealing never before heard testimony to separate fact from fiction.

programme.title: Craig Charles: UFO Conspiracies
programme.desc: Long-time UFO enthusiast Craig Charles and astrophysicist Sarah Cruddas scrutinise compelling evidence relating to some of the most perplexing UFO encounters of recent years, revealing never before heard testimony to separate fact from fiction.

programme.title: Britains Secret Islands
programme.desc: An exploration of Rathlin Island, including a visit to a Neolithic stone tool factory, a unique upside-down lighthouse, and a WWII shipwreck.

programme.title: Britains Secret Islands
programme.desc: A trip through Englands south coast, diving with blue sharks, exploring the battlements of Drakes Island, learning the origins of Scouts, and checking out fossils on the Isle of Wight.

programme.title: River Hunters
programme.desc: River Hunters sees Rick and river-searching expert Beau searching the unexplored rivers and waterways of Britain, unearthing treasures from the past which reveal how our various ancestors used to live.

programme.title: River Hunters
programme.desc: River Hunters sees Rick and river-searching expert Beau searching the unexplored rivers and waterways of Britain, unearthing treasures from the past which reveal how our various ancestors used to live.

programme.title: Britains Most Historic Towns
programme.desc: Alice tells the story of Norman England by studying the history of Winchester, Britains most Norman city. Alice attempts to storm a castle in chain mail, investigates the origins of modern surgery and tucks in to an appetising eel pie.

programme.title: Britains Most Historic Towns
programme.desc: In Norwich, the UKs most Tudor city, Professor Alice Roberts learns about religious intolerance, uncovers the Norwich FC canarys origins and experiences humiliating Tudor justice.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson hikes 45 miles through the Weald in Kent and the Downs of East Sussex to discover the areas rich and surprising Tudor heritage. At the impressively preserved Penshurst Place, author Philippa Gregory helps Tony relish the fate of the Grand Duke of Buckingham at the hands of the young Henry VIII. Tony finishes in Lewes, where he relives one of the more brutal monastic dissolutions.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: In the final episode of the series Tony takes on a tough four-day trek through the Kintail region of the west Scottish Highlands to discover the story of the Jacobite uprisings of the early 1700s. On three occasions, Highland armies, assisted by the French and the Spanish, attempted to overthrow the King and put a Stuart back on the throne.

programme.title: Digging for Britain
programme.desc: Skeletons tell of both violent death and tenderness at the royal seat of power in Bamburgh, Northumbria, while at a remarkable community project at a shopping centre in Sittingbourne, people curate the grave goods of their own ancestors.

programme.title: Digging for Britain
programme.desc: In the final episode Dr Alice Roberts goes in search of the Tudor age, a time that saw momentous changes across all aspects of British life. Along the way Alice visits excavations at Shakespeares first theatre in Londons Shoreditch, where the Bard began his career and `Romeo and Juliet was first performed. Alice also joins a team sifting through Shakespeares rubbish at his last home in Stratford-Upon-Avon.

programme.title: Ross Kemp: Deep Sea Treasure Hunter
programme.desc: Ross heads to Portsmouth and the Mary Rose Museum and takes up an opportunity he cant turn down, to be one of the few divers allowed on the site of Britains most famous wreck, the Mary Rose.

programme.title: Ross Kemp: Deep Sea Treasure Hunter
programme.desc: Ross hops round the coast from Portsmouth to Plymouth, then on to the Gulf of Suez. A bout of hypercapnia leaves Ross shaken after the dive of a 17th century shipwreck.

programme.title: Royal Autopsy
programme.desc: Professor Alice Roberts pieces together how and why King Charles II died by bringing together a blend of historical and medical expertise, and by using contemporaneous accounts and documents.

programme.title: Home Sweet Homicide

programme.title: American Monster

Ferne breaks down and opens up to best friend James Argent about everything shes been through and how low she is.

programme.title: Peppa Pig

programme.title: Peppa Pig

programme.title: Peppa Pig

programme.title: Peppa Pig

programme.title: Peppa Pig

programme.desc: Peppa and George realise that they have shadows and no matter what they do, they cant escape from them.

programme.title: Peppa Pig

programme.desc: Peppas family car breaks down. While it is being repaired, they borrow a shiny new one from Grandad Dogs garage.

programme.title: Peppa Pig

programme.title: Peppa Pig

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and George are visiting their big cousin Chloe, and will get to meet Chloes new baby brother Alexander for the first time.

programme.desc: Its a lovely day for a picnic. Peppa and George feed bread to the ducks and Daddy Pig is chased by a wasp.

programme.desc: Mummy Pig is determined that Georges new hat doesnt get muddy when Peppa and George visit Grandpa and Granny Pig. Everyone tries to make sure that it stays clean - even if it means that they get messy instead!

programme.title: Angel of Death
programme.desc: As the number of deaths at a medical centre climbs, the night staff begins to suspect that someone is poisoning the patients.

programme.title: Murderous Minds: Harold Shipman
programme.desc: Harold Shipman was an English general practitioner and serial killer. He is considered to be one of the most prolific serial killers in modern history, with an estimated 250 victims.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: In 1849, a man suddenly disappeared in Bermondsey. The discovery that he had been brutally murdered enraptured the press and the public. Even Charles Dickens was totally engrossed in the story of the sinister Marie Manning.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: At the time of Jack the Ripper, London was also terrorised by the elusive Borough Poisoner, George Chapman.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: In 1910, the infamous Dr Crippen killed his wife and buried her in the basement. This darkly fascinating series reveals how he was caught trying to flee to Canada.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.sub-title: The Brides in the Bath Killer
programme.desc: Evil George Smith married and murdered several wives in the 1910s. Hear how a revolutionary pathologist used pioneering forensic methods to catch him.

programme.title: Dark Waters of Crime
programme.desc: Following the gruesome discovery of a skeleton on an island in New Brunswick, detectives seek to unravel the mystery of the woman with no name.

programme.title: Dark Waters of Crime
programme.sub-title: The Mystery of the Disarticulated Feet
programme.desc: For criminals, water is a perfect accomplice for the perfect murder, it erases, engulfs and takes away bodies, weapons and clues. This explains why within two years, seven disembodied feet wash up on various beaches in southern British Columbia.

programme.title: Dark Waters of Crime
programme.desc: Investigators have devised extraordinary measures to solve crimes involving water.

programme.title: The Manson Murders
programme.desc: The Manson Family, led by Charles Manson, committed a set of crimes that terrified the world and brought the flower power movement to a halt. Charles Milles Manson was an American criminal and musician who led the Manson Family, a cult based in California.

programme.title: Mansons Missing Victims
programme.desc: Stories about people who disappeared when they attempted to leave the Barker Ranch.

programme.title: Myra Hindley: The Untold Story
programme.desc: Exploring Hindleys childhood and the start of her relationship with Brady.

programme.title: Myra Hindley: The Untold Story
programme.desc: The stories of the victims and those who got away.

programme.title: Myra Hindley: The Untold Story
programme.desc: A look at the life and crimes of infamous killer Myra Hindley. This film explores the stories of Brady and Hindleys five known murder victims and the accounts of the children who got away, most notably David Smith.

programme.title: Prime Crime
programme.desc: Prime Crime takes a deep dive into the most high profile and memorable cases that have defined the true crime genre.

programme.title: Prime Crime
programme.desc: Prime Crime takes a deep dive into the most high profile and memorable cases that have defined the true crime genre.

programme.title: Prime Crime

programme.title: FBI: Criminal Pursuit
programme.desc: A predator in a white truck abducts a 10-year-old girl as she rollerblades in front of her house. Will FBI agents be able to find Pamela before its too late?

programme.title: FBI: Criminal Pursuit
programme.desc: Teenage mum Rachel elopes with a mystery man and two weeks later her body is found chained and weighted in a lake. Who murdered her, and is her baby still alive?

programme.title: FBI: Criminal Pursuit
programme.desc: After small town family man Andie is murdered at a shopping centre, the case goes unsolved for 15 years. Can the FBI unravel this sordid tale of adultery and greed?

programme.title: You Belong to Me: Sex, Race and Murder in the South
programme.desc: In 1952, a prominent black woman killed a white doctor in Florida after suffering years of sexual abuse at his hands. Despite abundant evidence that she was acting in self-defence, a jury found her guilty and sentenced her to death.

programme.title: Surviving Sinaga
programme.desc: Reynhard Sinaga is the UKs most prolific rapist. Meeting men outside Manchester nightclubs, he drugged, sexually assaulted and filmed his depraved acts with at least 200 young men for the past 12 years. Featuring interviews with those affected.

programme.title: Fred and Rose West: Love and Murder
programme.desc: Fred and Rose West raped, tortured and murdered at least a dozen young British girls between 1967 and 1987, including several of their own daughters. Learn how two of Britains most notorious serial killers were able to get away with their crimes for so long, how they hid the victims remains within the confines of their own home, and how they were eventually taken down.

programme.title: Murderers And Their Mothers
programme.sub-title: Fred and Rosemary West: Killer Couple
programme.desc: A look at the relationships between murderers and their mothers.

programme.title: Myra Hindley: The Untold Story
programme.desc: Exploring Hindleys childhood and the start of her relationship with Brady.

programme.title: Myra Hindley: The Untold Story
programme.desc: The stories of the victims and those who got away.

programme.title: Myra Hindley: The Untold Story
programme.desc: A look at the life and crimes of infamous killer Myra Hindley. This film explores the stories of Brady and Hindleys five known murder victims and the accounts of the children who got away, most notably David Smith.

programme.title: Myra Hindley: The Untold Story
programme.desc: A look at the life and crimes of infamous killer Myra Hindley. This film explores the stories of Brady and Hindleys five known murder victims and the accounts of the children who got away, most notably David Smith.

programme.title: Into The Wild: Horses and Dingos
programme.desc: Snowy Mountains wild horses adapt to predators, neighbors, and harsh but nourishing conditions.

programme.title: Into The Wild: Horses and Dingos
programme.desc: Australias wild horses adapt to threats, using inherited knowledge to survive harsh conditions.

programme.title: Secrets of the Great White Shark
programme.desc: Studying the history of the great white shark, alongside their anatomy and how theyve helped the oceans for hundreds of millions of years. However, in the modern age they face extinction as over 1,000 million sharks are killed every year.

programme.title: Sperm Whales, Dealing With the Unexpected
programme.desc: A family of sperm whales deals with rapid changes to its environment near the Crozet Islands.

programme.title: Hidden Australia
programme.desc: Australia is known for its sun-kissed beaches, however the 2,500 miles between the coasts are made up of a patchwork of contrasting landscapes, such as tropical rainforests, snow-capped mountains, dry woodlands, tropical reefs, and hostile desert.

programme.title: Into The Wild: Horses and Dingos
programme.desc: Dingoes rely on teamwork and social roles to raise pups and survive harsh Australian winters.

programme.title: Animal Rescue School
programme.desc: The trainees start working real-life cases alone. Becky deals with an abandoned cat, Jess deals with a horse being kept in a back garden and Georgie assists in a dispute over a cat.

programme.title: Animal Rescue School
programme.desc: The trainees are investigating cases by themselves for the first time. Debs deals with a potentially deadly snake, Rowena rushes to rescue a rabbit and Jess helps a boxer with a lump.

programme.title: Animal Rescue School
programme.desc: Becky helps an injured bird, Rowena investigates a case of cruelty to dogs, and both Natalies help cats that need care, as they all prove theyre ready to become full-time inspectors.

programme.title: A New Prehistory
programme.desc: The insects of today are tiny, and the only giant ones are in nightmares. 320 million years ago, though, dragonflies measuring a metre and centipedes the size of a human thrived on Earth. Taking a closer look at what caused their extinction.

programme.title: A New Prehistory
programme.desc: From herds of feather-covered dinosaurs to dragonflies larger than seagulls, new fossils discovered in China have created new questions about prehistoric feathered beasts.

programme.title: A New Prehistory
programme.desc: China fossils have allowed for recreating the missing branches in the tree of life. Researchers can trace prehistoric mammal evolution back another 35 million years and have learned they were more numerous and varied than previously thought.

programme.title: Life in the Animal Kingdom
programme.desc: From majestic lions and soaring peregrines to mysterious manta rays and gentle manatees, explore a world brimming with extraordinary species.

programme.title: Life in the Animal Kingdom
programme.desc: From majestic lions and soaring peregrines to mysterious manta rays and gentle manatees, explore a world brimming with extraordinary species.

programme.title: Life in the Animal Kingdom
programme.desc: From majestic lions and soaring peregrines to mysterious manta rays and gentle manatees, explore a world brimming with extraordinary species.

programme.title: Life in the Animal Kingdom
programme.desc: From majestic lions and soaring peregrines to mysterious manta rays and gentle manatees, explore a world brimming with extraordinary species.

programme.title: Lioness in Exile
programme.desc: Manyari takes an unusual step when she takes her young cubs away from the sanctuary of the clan.

programme.title: Jaguar: King of the Jungle
programme.desc: The jaguar is the third largest of the big cats, and pound for pound, the most powerful. This jaguar patrols a home range of over 100 square kilometers in Brazil, deep in the heart of the worlds largest tropical rainforest.

programme.title: Leap of the Lynx
programme.desc: On the Iberian Peninsula, primeval landscapes are practically non-existent, so the Iberian lynx has lived on cultivated land for centuries - cattle, horse and pig pastures, cork oak forests, timberland, and even holy sites of pilgrimage.

programme.title: Lions On The Move
programme.desc: Challenging two part documentary with Kevin Richardson, looking at the challenges of moving 42 big cats to a new home in South Africa.

programme.title: Sharks - Scavengers of the Sea
programme.desc: Before being an earthly paradise with enchanting colours, the lagoon of New Caledonia is above all a paradise for sharks. Usually considered as fierce predators, sharks really are opportunistic scavengers. Scavengers that are not too picky when it comes to their menu. Filmed for four years in New Caledonia, this documentary shows footage of sharks never seen before.

programme.title: Face to Face With the Polar Bear
programme.desc: Twin polar bear cubs struggle to survive on a Norwegian fjord when complications arise from the rapidly warming summertime conditions.

programme.title: In the Land of the Moose
programme.desc: At the end of the summer, a moose finds herself alone in the forest. She has just lost her calf, probably to a bear. Now she must find a mate. Once pregnant again, she will endure months of bone-chilling winter until she delivers in the spring.

programme.title: A New Prehistory
programme.desc: The insects of today are tiny, and the only giant ones are in nightmares. 320 million years ago, though, dragonflies measuring a metre and centipedes the size of a human thrived on Earth. Taking a closer look at what caused their extinction.

programme.title: A New Prehistory
programme.desc: From herds of feather-covered dinosaurs to dragonflies larger than seagulls, new fossils discovered in China have created new questions about prehistoric feathered beasts.

programme.title: A New Prehistory
programme.desc: China fossils have allowed for recreating the missing branches in the tree of life. Researchers can trace prehistoric mammal evolution back another 35 million years and have learned they were more numerous and varied than previously thought.

programme.title: A New Prehistory

programme.title: Salvage Hunters

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman is on a rural property hunt in Devon, helping a couple to find their ideal country home for £400k. Nicki will also find out about the countys heritage underfoot when she visits a centuries old carpet manufacturer.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard runs a decorative salvage yard and is constantly looking for new stock.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters

programme.title: Salvage Hunters

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Resident clock expert Steven Fletcher and woodwork specialist William Kirk work together to repair a broken barometer clock. With a clock, barometer and thermometer on one object Steven has a lot of work ahead of him to get it looking like new again. Painting conservator Lucia Scalisi draws on her years of experience to restore a beautiful Caputo painting which has suffered a large tear. She expertly mends, cleans and re-touches the painting in time to reunite it with its delighted owner.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Resident ceramic expert Kirsten Ramsay takes on a beautiful Majolica Vase, which has met with several accidents over the years: a lid broken into several pieces, damage from a falling painting, and a decorative cherub who has been decapitated. Meanwhile metal worker Dominic Chinea works on a secret project, the restoration of a pub sign for the last landlord of much loved local that has been knocked down to make way for a bus station.

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Diane and Gary want an accessible holiday home with a pool and space for their family to visit in sunny Paphos on Cyprus. Laura Hamilton tries to find them the perfect place for their £130k.

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Two stories of people trying to uncover family mysteries. A man, left in a pram as a baby, is searching for his birth mother to discover the truth about his beginnings, and a daughter is looking for the Italian birth father she has never met.

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Two women try to find missing parents after half a century apart. Ann found her birth mother over a decade ago, and now wants to locate her birth father, and Amanda is on the trail of her birth mother who gave her up for adoption in the 1960s.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Auction House
programme.sub-title: Toying With a New Life Downunder
programme.desc: Auctioneer Angus Ashworth and his team are called out to peoples homes with a mission to sift through a lifetime of possessions and find forgotten treasures that can be sold at auction.

programme.sub-title: Can Toy Cars Get Us to the Arctic
programme.desc: Auctioneer Angus Ashworth and his team are called out to peoples homes with a mission to sift through a lifetime of possessions and find forgotten treasures that can be sold at auction.

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: The third leg of this antiques odyssey with Catherine Southon and Philip Serrell has them pootling the old Citroen through the West Country. Catherine decides to change her buying strategy, going for more of Philips rust-and-woodworm fare. True to form, Phil diverts to the beach and asks a local fisherman if he has some antique chandlery to sell!

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Catherine Southon and Philip Serrell are road tripping along the beautiful Cornish coastline in a classic Citroen DS20, in the hunt for antique treasures. Before the auction in Bristol, Catherine heads to Porthcurno to see firsthand the incredible cables that stretch from this little village, along the sea bed, to South America, Australia and India. Meanwhile, Phil goes for a ride on a replica of the Puffing Devil - one of the first steam powered vehicles in the world, gosh!

programme.title: Long Lost Family: Born Without Trace
programme.desc: Foundlings are people who were abandoned as babies, often in the first hours and days of their lives. Born without a trace, they have had no way to unlock the secrets of their past. By combining new DNA technology with painstaking detective work, the mysteries of people with unknown beginnings who are desperate for answers can now be solved. Presented by Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell, the team behind `Long Lost Family use an extraordinary new technique to try and identify birth families and find answers for people who have spent decades trying to find out where they came from.

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Two people go in search of their missing birth mothers. A woman taken to Morocco as a toddler against her mothers will searches for her birth mother while a man given up as a baby because of the colour of his skin searches for the truth about his family.

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell present the stories of two women who uncovered life-changing news as adults that led them on a hunt for long-lost siblings. Whilst searching for her birth mother, Sian Jones discovered she has a sister out there somewhere and Long Lost Family help her search for both mother and sister. Meanwhile, Teleena Faux always believed she was the youngest of six siblings until she found evidence of a younger brother. Teleena has been desperate to find him ever since.

programme.title: Help! My House is Haunted

programme.title: Open Season 3
programme.desc: After Boog switches places with a circus bear, Elliott and the gang must rescue him before the circus returns home to Russia.

programme.title: Migration
programme.desc: A family of ducks decides to leave the safety of a New England pond for an adventurous trip to Jamaica. However, their well-laid plans quickly go awry when they get lost and wind up in New York City.

programme.title: The Pirates! In an Adventure With Scientists
programme.desc: An inept swashbuckler decides to make an attempt to win the Pirate of the Year Award, and beat his rivals Black Bellamy and Cutlass Liz in a race to plunder the most booty. His journey takes him to Victorian London where the Pirate Captain must choose between winning Pirate of the Year, or helping his crew.

programme.title: Home
programme.desc: After an alien race called the Boov take over Earth, a resourceful human girl becomes a banished Boovs ally.

programme.title: Over the Hedge
programme.desc: An opportunistic raccoon teaches fellow animals about the edible treasures that the new humans in the neighbourhood conveniently leave outdoors.

programme.title: Over the Hedge
programme.desc: An opportunistic raccoon teaches fellow animals about the edible treasures that the new humans in the neighbourhood conveniently leave outdoors.

programme.title: Its Complicated
programme.desc: When attending their sons college graduation, a couple reignite the spark in their relationship. However, the complication lies in the fact that they are divorced and he has remarried.

programme.title: Dumb and Dumber
programme.desc: A pair of idiotic friends set off on a madcap journey to return a briefcase to its owner. However, they are blissfully unaware that the case contains a large amount of ransom money for the owners kidnapped husband. Their trip is soon fraught with disaster, especially when the kidnappers begin to pursue them across the country with the aim of grabbing the cash.

programme.title: Dumb and Dumber To
programme.desc: Twenty years after their last adventure, good-hearted, yet dimwitted best friends, Harry Dunne and Lloyd Christmas head out in search for Harrys long lost daughter, and Lloyds in love again.

programme.title: National Lampoons Christmas Vacation
programme.desc: Clark Griswold sets out to give his family a traditional Christmas. While his in-laws, among them a cousin from hell, sample his hospitality, they find themselves battling against rabid squirrels, and an exploding sewer to achieve a family Christmas that they will never forget.

programme.title: Click
programme.desc: A workaholic father finds that there are not enough hours in the day to balance his job and home life, until he discovers a remote control that can pause and rewind time. However, when it malfunctions, chaos ensues, and the man realises that he has lost control of his life.

programme.title: 13 Going on 30
programme.desc: Jenna is desperate for acceptance at school. After wishing that she was older, she wakes up with a job, a flat and a boyfriend, but is being 30 all its cracked up to be? Jenna discovers she isnt the person she thought shed be when she grew up.

programme.title: Twins
programme.desc: Two very different twin brothers were born as a result of a genetic experiment. Following their birth, the flawless Julius grew up on a paradise island, while the less-than-perfect Vincent was sent to an orphanage. Now, many years later, Vincent is a thief and con man with huge debts. What will Julius think when he searches for his long-lost twin and finds him in jail?

programme.title: The Other Guys
programme.desc: While New York detectives Christopher Danson and PK Highsmith wow the city with their heroics, colleagues Allen Gamble and Terry Hoitz are the `other guys. Chained to their desks, forensic accountant Gamble and disgraced cop Hoitz are at each others throats when an unfortunate incident gives them the opportunity to prove themselves.

programme.title: Groundhog Day
programme.desc: A cynical TV weatherman finds himself reliving the same day over and over again when he goes on location to the small town of Punxsutawney to film a report about their annual Groundhog Day. His predicament drives him to distraction, until he sees a way of turning the situation to his advantage.

programme.title: Beverly Hills Cop II
programme.desc: The hard-nosed Detroit cop from the original film returns to Los Angeles to help solve another case. This time he must direct his efforts towards unraveling the Alphabet Crimes, a series of robberies committed by leather-jacketed punks. The investigation puts him on the trail of an illegal arms dealer and his hit lady.

programme.title: Billy Madison
programme.desc: Billy is the son of hotel chain magnate Brian Madison and expects to inherit the family fortune, but hes shocked when his father stipulates he wont unless he passes 12th grade in just 24 weeks. It will be tough, since he never passed 1st grade. Determined to prove his father wrong, Billy enrols at school.

programme.title: Disaster Movie
programme.desc: A group of twentysomethings attempt to survive an onslaught of earthquakes, asteroids and other impending catastrophes.

programme.title: Galaxy Quest
programme.desc: The stars of a 1970s sci-fi show - now scraping a living through re-runs and sci-fi conventions - are beamed aboard an alien spacecraft. Believing the casts heroic on-screen dramas are historical documents of real-life adventures, the band of aliens turn to the ailing celebrities for help in their quest to overcome the oppressive regime in their solar system.

programme.title: Kangaroo Jack
programme.desc: Two childhood friends get caught up in with the mob in New York and find themselves forced to travel to Australia to deliver $50,000. Their trouble really starts when they reach the outback, and a kangaroo bounds away with the cash.

programme.title: Smokey and the Bandit
programme.desc: Tongue-in-cheek tale about a high-speed car chase across America involving a sheriff and a bootlegger with crash stunts galore. All goes well for the Bandit as he drives from Texas to Georgia with a truckload of illicit beer until he stops to pick up a damsel in distress, who also happens to be the sheriffs daughter.

programme.title: Smokey and the Bandit
programme.desc: Tongue-in-cheek tale about a high-speed car chase across America involving a sheriff and a bootlegger with crash stunts galore. All goes well for the Bandit as he drives from Texas to Georgia with a truckload of illicit beer until he stops to pick up a damsel in distress, who also happens to be the sheriffs daughter.

programme.title: Scent of a Woman
programme.desc: Frank is a retired Lt Col in the US army. Hes blind and impossible to get along with. Charlie is at school and is looking forward to going to university; to help pay for a trip home for Christmas, he agrees to look after Frank over thanksgiving. Franks niece says this will be easy money, but she didnt reckon on Frank spending his Thanksgiving in New York.

programme.title: The Bridge on the River Kwai
programme.desc: British POWs are ordered by their Japanese captors to construct a bridge of strategic importance and are happy to sabotage and delay the progress until their commanding officers orders them to continue the work unhindered to its completion, but are his actions tantamount to collaborating with the enemy?

programme.title: True Grit
programme.desc: John Wayne won an Oscar here as Rooster Cogburn, a lawman recruited by a teenager seeking revenge on her fathers murderer.

programme.title: The Kings Speech
programme.desc: Afflicted with a stammer, Prince Albert, the Duke of York, dreads the speaking engagements that come with being the son of King George V.

programme.title: Darkest Hour
programme.desc: With the German Army now just across the Channel, newly-appointed Prime Minister Winston Churchill must decide between negotiating a peace treaty with Hitler or standing firm. With the King, the public and his own political party all questioning his wisdom, the hard-drinking Churchill has to survive his own darkest hour and rally the country behind him.

programme.title: Lost in Translation
programme.desc: In Tokyo shooting a whisky commercial, middle-aged actor Bob Harris becomes attracted to Charlotte, the young wife of a celebrity photographer. Together they ride out their boredom of hotel life and their bewilderment of the city.

programme.title: Grease
programme.desc: High-spirited musical set in 1950s America, in which a girl and boy who met on the beach are unexpectedly reunited at high school. She cannot understand how different he has become. Can the leather-clad, tough-talking leader of the T-Birds really be the same person? Perhaps her new friends, the Pink Ladies, can help her win back his heart?

programme.title: It Ends With Us
programme.desc: Lily Bloom falls for a charming neurosurgeon after she moves to Boston to chase her dream of opening her own business. However, when her first love suddenly reenters her life, her relationship gets upended, leaving her with an impossible choice.

programme.title: P.S. I Love You
programme.desc: New York widow Holly is devastated by her husbands sudden demise, but messages he left behind offer a ray of hope.

programme.title: Dreamgirls
programme.desc: Following the adventures of The Dreamettes, an all-girl singing group. Theyre going nowhere fast until they meet fast-talking car salesman-come-manager who has ambitions to make a fortune selling black music to a white audience. He persuades them to become backing singers for James `Thunder Early, but the larger-than-life lead singer Effie White must step out of the spotlight in favour of the more image-friendly Deena Jones.

programme.title: Dear John
programme.desc: Whilst on leave, a Marine falls in love with a college student. The long-distance relationship is then tested when the Marine decides to re-enlist post-9/11.

programme.title: The Bridges at Toko-Ri
programme.desc: A conflicted Navy pilot and veteran of the Second World War questions the role he is forced to play when he is called back into service for the Korean War.

programme.title: The Bridges at Toko-Ri
programme.desc: A conflicted Navy pilot and veteran of the Second World War questions the role he is forced to play when he is called back into service for the Korean War.

programme.title: A Tigers Journey
programme.desc: In the valleys of the Himalayas, an orphan boy saves a Bengal tiger cub from poachers who killed the animals mother. The two head to the Taktsang monastery in Buthan, known as "The Tigers Nest".

programme.title: Ride On
programme.desc: Washed-up stuntman Luo seeks help from his estranged daughter and her lawyer boyfriend when his beloved stunt horse may be auctioned off to pay his debts. Luo and Red Hare become a media sensation when their fight with debt collectors goes viral.

programme.title: Save The Cinema
programme.desc: Sky Original film following Welsh hairdresser Liz Evans fight to save her small towns theatre. Poignant British drama based on a true story starring Samantha Morton.

programme.title: The SpongeBob SquarePants Movie
programme.desc: Theres trouble brewing in Bikini Bottom. Someone has stolen King Neptunes crown, and it looks like Mr Krab, SpongeBobs boss, is the culprit. Though hes just been passed over for the promotion of his dreams, SpongeBob stands by his boss, and along with his best pal Patrick, sets out on a treacherous mission to Shell City to reclaim the crown and save Mr Krabs life.

programme.title: Friend or Foe
programme.desc: WWII evacuee David hates the Germans, but now his life has been saved by one. What is the right thing to do, tell the Army or offer his help?

programme.title: A Tigers Journey
programme.desc: In the valleys of the Himalayas, an orphan boy saves a Bengal tiger cub from poachers who killed the animals mother. The two head to the Taktsang monastery in Buthan, known as "The Tigers Nest".

programme.title: Finding Neverland
programme.desc: Its London in 1904, and writer JM Barrie is inspired by a family he meets, mother Sylvia and her four children, Peter, Jack, George and Michael. From the time he spends with them, he writes the famous childrens novel `Peter Pan.

programme.title: Lemony Snickets A Series of Unfortunate Events
programme.desc: Three orphans are sent to live with their uncle Count Olaf, but he only wants their family fortune. What follows is a battle of wits.

programme.title: The Flintstones
programme.desc: Live-action version of the classic stone-age cartoon series. Fred Flintstone donates his family savings to help neighbour Barney Rubble and wife Betty adopt a child, much to the dismay of mother-in-law Pearl. To return the favour, Barney swaps slabs with Fred in an aptitude test, resulting in Freds being promoted and becoming involved in an embezzlement plot, while Barney is left in the dole queue.

programme.title: The Flintstones in Viva Rock Vegas
programme.desc: Prehistoric prequel in which working-class college leavers Fred and Barney decide to set off for a fun weekend in Rock Vegas with their two new girlfriends, Wilma and Betty. Fred, however, has a rival for the affections of his classy girlfriend Wilma - the wealthy playboy Chip Rockefeller.

programme.title: The SpongeBob SquarePants Movie
programme.desc: Theres trouble brewing in Bikini Bottom. Someone has stolen King Neptunes crown, and it looks like Mr Krab, SpongeBobs boss, is the culprit. Though hes just been passed over for the promotion of his dreams, SpongeBob stands by his boss, and along with his best pal Patrick, sets out on a treacherous mission to Shell City to reclaim the crown and save Mr Krabs life.

programme.title: The Mountain
programme.desc: Raised outside of her M?ori culture, tween Sam sets out on a mission with two other misfits to reconnect with her tupuna: Taranaki Maunga. Together, the three go on an unconventional journey and discover the power of friendship.

programme.title: Bookworm
programme.desc: Eleven-year-old Mildreds world is turned upside down when her estranged father, a washed-up magician, comes back to look after her and takes her camping to find the mythological Canterbury Panther.

programme.title: Paulie
programme.desc: A wisecracking parrot caged in a research lab tells his life story to a lonely janitor. Before coming to the science lab, he has passed through the hands of a succession of owners, from a petty criminal to a man who runs a parrot-dancing act. Touched by his colourful story, the janitor conspires to liberate the talking bird.

programme.title: The Flintstones in Viva Rock Vegas
programme.desc: Prehistoric prequel in which working-class college leavers Fred and Barney decide to set off for a fun weekend in Rock Vegas with their two new girlfriends, Wilma and Betty. Fred, however, has a rival for the affections of his classy girlfriend Wilma - the wealthy playboy Chip Rockefeller.

programme.title: Lemony Snickets A Series of Unfortunate Events
programme.desc: Three orphans are sent to live with their uncle Count Olaf, but he only wants their family fortune. What follows is a battle of wits.

programme.title: Nativity 2: Danger in the Manger!
programme.desc: A new teacher juggles his pregnant wife and a class of children on a road trip.

programme.title: Nativity 3: Dude Wheres My Donkey?
programme.desc: An Ofsted inspector arrives at St. Bernadettes and forgets who he is.

programme.title: The Flintstones
programme.desc: Live-action version of the classic stone-age cartoon series. Fred Flintstone donates his family savings to help neighbour Barney Rubble and wife Betty adopt a child, much to the dismay of mother-in-law Pearl. To return the favour, Barney swaps slabs with Fred in an aptitude test, resulting in Freds being promoted and becoming involved in an embezzlement plot, while Barney is left in the dole queue.

programme.title: Johnny English
programme.desc: Spoof spy caper with the eponymous, blundering hero attempting to recover the crown jewels and save Britain from an evil mastermind when all the other agents are killed. Promoted from lowly pen pusher to super spy, Johnny English is baffled when clues lead to respected entrepreneur Pascal Sauvage, but could the enigmatic Lorna hold the key to the mystery?

programme.title: The Golden Compass
programme.desc: In a parallel universe, young orphan Lyra Belacqua resides in Oxford under the patronage of her dashing adventurer Uncle, Lord Asriel. When Lyra comes into possession of an alethiometer, a compass that truthfully answers any question, there are people who will do anything to get hold of it, and Lyra finds herself on an epic quest to the frozen North to safeguard the future of her entire world.

programme.title: Peter Rabbit
programme.desc: Peter Rabbit and his three sisters -- Flopsy, Mopsy and Cotton-Tail -- enjoy spending their days in Mr. McGregors vegetable garden. When one of McGregors relatives suddenly moves in, hes less than thrilled to discover a family of rabbits in his new home. A battle of wills soon breaks out as the new owner hatches scheme after scheme to get rid of Peter -- a resourceful rabbit who proves to be a worthy and wily opponent.

programme.title: Small Soldiers
programme.desc: A toy company develops action-figure soldiers whose realistic fighting capabilities cause mayhem for a toy-shop owner and his family. Unaware of their military prowess, the shop keeper takes delivery of the soldiers, who break free from their packaging to attack their Gorgonite enemies. When the Gorgonites communicate with the shop keepers son, the humans find themselves under siege.

programme.title: Finding Neverland
programme.desc: Its London in 1904, and writer JM Barrie is inspired by a family he meets, mother Sylvia and her four children, Peter, Jack, George and Michael. From the time he spends with them, he writes the famous childrens novel `Peter Pan.

programme.title: Paulie
programme.desc: A wisecracking parrot caged in a research lab tells his life story to a lonely janitor. Before coming to the science lab, he has passed through the hands of a succession of owners, from a petty criminal to a man who runs a parrot-dancing act. Touched by his colourful story, the janitor conspires to liberate the talking bird.

programme.title: 48 HRS.
programme.desc: When a vicious convict breaks out of a San Francisco jail, the tough but weary cop assigned to the case needs all the help he can get, even if that means working with another con. The smart-mouthed, wiseguy prisoner has his own reasons for wanting his fellow cons rampage stopped, and a 48-hour release from jail is arranged so that cop and con can achieve their mutual goal - if they dont kill each other first.

programme.title: Superman II
programme.desc: Having fallen in love with Lois, Superman agrees to sacrifice his powers to be with her. His last act as a superhero has an unexpected side effect, when a bomb he hurls into space to save the Eiffel Tower accidentally releases the three villains trapped in the `Phantom Zone in the first `Superman movie. The super criminals set about conquering the Earth, while Clark sits helpless.

programme.title: Last Action Hero
programme.desc: Eleven-year-old Danny is given a magic ticket by a strange projectionist and is transported into the cinema screen. Thanks to his advance knowledge of the plot, he is able to help his silver-screen hero out of an awkward situation and becomes his partner. Theres trouble in store for the unlikely duo when the villain tries to seize the magic ticket.

programme.title: The Cinema List: Job Hunting
programme.desc: Fancy a career change? This week, the Cinema List goes hunting for jobs with these film names as a guide. From `The Mechanic to `The Accountant, dust off your CV with these hardworking hits.

programme.title: Saving Private Ryan
programme.desc: Oscar-winning World War II tale combining the story of an unusual rescue mission with an overwhelmingly powerful re-creation of the D-Day landings. A group of American soldiers are dispatched to locate one man among thousands, a US private whose three brothers have all been killed in action. The powers that be want to send him home to his family.

programme.title: Waynes World
programme.desc: Wayne and Garth battle an evil TV producer in this big-screen adaptation of the `Saturday Night Live skit.

programme.title: Waynes World 2
programme.desc: Comedy sequel in which Wayne and Garth decide to stage a rock festival. After losing his late-night cable show, Wayne has a dream in which Jim Morrison tells him to put on a massive music festival - Waynestock. Before this can be achieved, the budding promoters must overcome several hurdles and sort out their turbulent love lives.

programme.title: Happy Gilmore
programme.desc: Happy Gilmore is a bad boy ice hockey player who fails to make the grade because he cant skate or control his temper, but he does have a powerful shot and realises he can hit a golf ball 400 yards. When his grans house is repossessed because she never paid tax, he agrees to take up golf to try and win enough money to buy it back, but he cant putt and the golfing establishment arent happy to have him around.

programme.title: The Blues Brothers
programme.desc: The story of a pair of blues musicians who try to raise the money to save an orphanage by reuniting their old band - nearly writing off Chicago in the process.

programme.title: Trading Places
programme.desc: Sporting billionaire brothers reverse the roles of a Wall Street commodities broker and a street hustler.

programme.title: 28 Days Later
programme.desc: A small group of survivors try to stay a step ahead of the vicious, virus-infected humans that have overrun London.

programme.title: 48 HRS.
programme.desc: When a vicious convict breaks out of a San Francisco jail, the tough but weary cop assigned to the case needs all the help he can get, even if that means working with another con. The smart-mouthed, wiseguy prisoner has his own reasons for wanting his fellow cons rampage stopped, and a 48-hour release from jail is arranged so that cop and con can achieve their mutual goal - if they dont kill each other first.

programme.title: Event Horizon
programme.desc: After disappearing for seven years, revolutionary spaceship Event Horizon is rediscovered. The team of scientists sent to investigate find that the entire crew is dead, and a terrifying, malevolent presence is lurking on board.

programme.title: See No Evil, Hear No Evil
programme.desc: Lighthearted adventures of a pair of news vendors in New York - one deaf, one blind - who go on the run when they are blamed for the murder of a customer. Each has seen - or heard - just a whiff of a clue, and a frantic chase ensues as the duo struggle to clear their names.

programme.title: See No Evil, Hear No Evil
programme.desc: Lighthearted adventures of a pair of news vendors in New York - one deaf, one blind - who go on the run when they are blamed for the murder of a customer. Each has seen - or heard - just a whiff of a clue, and a frantic chase ensues as the duo struggle to clear their names.

programme.title: I Am Legend
programme.desc: In the year 2012, scientists engineer a cure for cancer. Three years later, every human in New York is dead or mutated into a light-sensitive zombie by the virus that was supposed to heal. Only one man survives, virologist Robert Neville. He has two aims: find a cure for the virus and make contact with other survivors.

programme.title: The BFG
programme.desc: A 10-year-old girl, Queen Victoria and the Big Friendly Giant must devise a plan to get rid of Bloodbottler, Fleshlumpeater and all the other bad giants once and for all.

programme.title: Charlie and the Chocolate Factory
programme.desc: Charlie Bucket comes from a poor family, and spends most of his time dreaming about the chocolate that he loves but usually cant afford. Things change when Willy Wonka, head of the very popular Wonka Chocolate empire, announces a contest in which five gold tickets have been hidden in chocolate bars. Charlie is one of the five kids who finds a lucky ticket and goes on a tour of Wonkas chocolate factory.

programme.title: Peter Rabbit
programme.desc: Peter Rabbit and his three sisters -- Flopsy, Mopsy and Cotton-Tail -- enjoy spending their days in Mr. McGregors vegetable garden. When one of McGregors relatives suddenly moves in, hes less than thrilled to discover a family of rabbits in his new home. A battle of wills soon breaks out as the new owner hatches scheme after scheme to get rid of Peter -- a resourceful rabbit who proves to be a worthy and wily opponent.

programme.title: Peter Rabbit 2
programme.desc: Despite his efforts, Peter cant seem to shake his reputation for mischief among the other rabbits. Once he adventures out of the garden Peter finds himself in a world where mischief is appreciated, but soon his family come to bring him home.

programme.title: Despicable Me 4
programme.desc: Gru welcomes a new member to the family, Gru Jr., whos intent on tormenting his dad. However, their peaceful existence soon comes crashing down when criminal mastermind Maxime Le Mal escapes from prison and vows revenge against Gru.

programme.title: Venom
programme.desc: Journalist Eddie Brock is trying to take down Carlton Drake, the notorious and brilliant founder of the Life Foundation. While investigating one of Drakes experiments, Eddies body merges with the alien Venom -- leaving him with superhuman strength and power. Twisted, dark and fueled by rage, Venom tries to control the new and dangerous abilities that Eddie finds so intoxicating.

programme.title: Venom: Let There Be Carnage
programme.desc: Eddie Brock is still struggling to coexist with the shape-shifting extraterrestrial Venom. When deranged serial killer Cletus Kasady also becomes host to an alien symbiote, Brock and Venom must put aside their differences to stop his reign of terror.

programme.title: Venom: The Last Dance
programme.desc: Eddie Brock and Venom must make a devastating decision as theyre pursued by a mysterious military man and alien monsters from Venoms home world.

programme.title: Dune: Part Two
programme.desc: Paul Atreides unites with Chani and the Fremen while seeking revenge against the conspirators who destroyed his family. Facing a choice between the love of his life and the fate of the universe, he must prevent a terrible future only he can foresee.

programme.title: IT
programme.desc: Seven young outcasts in Derry, Maine, are about to face their worst nightmare -- an ancient, shape-shifting evil that emerges from the sewer every 27 years to prey on the towns children. Banding together over the course of one horrifying summer, the friends must overcome their own personal fears to battle the murderous, bloodthirsty clown known as Pennywise.

programme.title: I Am Legend
programme.desc: In the year 2012, scientists engineer a cure for cancer. Three years later, every human in New York is dead or mutated into a light-sensitive zombie by the virus that was supposed to heal. Only one man survives, virologist Robert Neville. He has two aims: find a cure for the virus and make contact with other survivors.

programme.title: King Kong
programme.desc: A down-on-her-luck actress accepts an offer to star in a film shot on a mysterious island. While there, the actress is abducted by natives who offer her as a sacrifice to a giant ape, which instead of harming the starlet becomes smitten with her. The crew manage to capture the ape and bring it back to Manhattan to exhibit as a showpiece. However, on the shows opening night, things go horribly wrong.

programme.title: Transformers
programme.desc: Geeky highschooler Sam Witwicky buys his first-ever car, hoping it will improve his chances with Mikaela. Imagine his surprise when his beat-down Camaro transforms into an alien robot called `Bumblebee and asks for his assistance in a deadly war.

programme.title: Venom
programme.desc: Journalist Eddie Brock is trying to take down Carlton Drake, the notorious and brilliant founder of the Life Foundation. While investigating one of Drakes experiments, Eddies body merges with the alien Venom -- leaving him with superhuman strength and power. Twisted, dark and fueled by rage, Venom tries to control the new and dangerous abilities that Eddie finds so intoxicating.

programme.title: Venom: Let There Be Carnage
programme.desc: Eddie Brock is still struggling to coexist with the shape-shifting extraterrestrial Venom. When deranged serial killer Cletus Kasady also becomes host to an alien symbiote, Brock and Venom must put aside their differences to stop his reign of terror.

programme.title: Venom: The Last Dance
programme.desc: Eddie Brock and Venom must make a devastating decision as theyre pursued by a mysterious military man and alien monsters from Venoms home world.

programme.title: Spider-Man
programme.desc: Adaptation of the adventures of the swinging comic-strip hero. A shy student becomes a crime fighter after a bite from a mutant spider, during a school outing, gives him extraordinary powers. As he comes to terms with his new-found abilities, he is also forced to contend with a maniac villain known as the Green Goblin.

programme.title: Spider-Man 2
programme.desc: The comic book web-slinger returns for a blockbusting sequel. Crime-fighting has cost Peter Parker his best friend and his true love Mary Jane. However, just as he quits as Spider-Man, New York comes under threat from Dr Octopus, a metal-tentacled madman. Peter has no choice but to swing back into action.

programme.title: Spider-Man 3
programme.desc: Life is sweet for Peter Parker, MJ loves him, her career is taking off and Spidey-mania is sweeping New York. However, when an alien parasite bonds to his suit, its not long before the good times and Spidey turn bad. While his ugly ego is taking centre stage, MJ is dumped from her Broadway show, Harry remembers Spider-Mans role in his fathers death, and Peter is consumed by revenge.

programme.title: Man of Steel
programme.desc: Though struggling with the ramifications of his extraordinary origin and abilities, young Clark Kent must become a hero and save those he loves from a dire threat.

programme.title: King Kong
programme.desc: A down-on-her-luck actress accepts an offer to star in a film shot on a mysterious island. While there, the actress is abducted by natives who offer her as a sacrifice to a giant ape, which instead of harming the starlet becomes smitten with her. The crew manage to capture the ape and bring it back to Manhattan to exhibit as a showpiece. However, on the shows opening night, things go horribly wrong.

programme.title: Lake George
programme.desc: Don is strong-armed by mobsters to execute a hit on Phyllis, but instead the two hatch a plan to steal money from the people who want her dead.

programme.title: The Stranger in My Home
programme.desc: Ali meets a mysterious man who claims to be the father of her teenage daughter, Katie. What begins as an unsettling encounter soon spirals into a nightmare of long-buried secrets, lies and obsession.

programme.title: Sky Cinema Preview
programme.desc: Previews of the great films now playing on Sky Cinema plus other highlights showing on Sky.

programme.title: grow
programme.desc: An exuberant tale full of giant pumpkins, madcap characters and a little girl who just might be a pumpkin-growing savant. (2025, 107 mins)

programme.title: Psycho Therapy: The Shallow Tale of a Writer Who Decided to Write About a Serial Killer
programme.desc: A writer befriends a retired serial killer in a desperate attempt to find inspiration for his next novel and save his marriage. Covering as his marriage counselor, the killer teaches him his methods as reality becomes deadlier than fiction.

programme.title: Ick
programme.desc: Science teacher Hanks life changes when he reconnects with his first love and suspects a new student is his daughter, all while facing an alien threat in their town.

programme.title: Companion
programme.desc: A weekend getaway turns bloody and violent when a subservient android thats built for human companionship goes haywire.

programme.title: The Woman in the Yard
programme.desc: Ramona becomes crippled by grief after the death of her husband, leaving her to care for her two children alone in her farmhouse. Her sadness soon turns to fear when a spectral woman in black appears on her front lawn, warning her "todays the day."

programme.title: Orangutan Jungle School
programme.desc: Dilla gives birth unexpectedly at midnight, but the delivery does not go smoothly. Plus, international celebrity, albino orangutan Alba, is released into the wild after rehabilitation.

programme.title: Wildlife ER
programme.desc: Joining vets Emily and Martine in the OR, where Dolly the koalas spaying surgery takes a scary turn. Seeing rescue officer Chantelles slick fix for a snared lizard, and probing a possible birdnapping with vet Karina.

programme.title: Malawi Wildlife Rescue
programme.desc: Amanda and visiting vet, Sophie pull out all the stops to give a vervet monkey with a broken leg a chance at returning to the wild. Alma receives a special orphan - a cat-like genet, and an antisocial baboon gets a chance at joining a troop.

programme.title: Africas Hunters
programme.desc: Two big male lions, twin brothers with a powerful bond, have ruled the Nsefu Pride for three years. Theyre fathers to all the young, and protectors of their territory.

programme.title: Monkey Life
programme.desc: Keeper Mike is on a mission in Moscow for a baby orang-utan called Joly, while back at the park her future home has been built. Meanwhile, in Paddys chimp group, Eddi has a `toddler tantrum; shes growing up, which means having to fend for herself, and shes not happy about it.

programme.title: Monkey Life
programme.desc: Orphaned baby orang-utan Joly arrives at the park from Moscow, but her new housemate Hsiao-Ning is not pleased to see her. Plus, theres another new arrival as orang-utan Ro-Ro gives birth, and animal manager Jeremy captures the incredible moment on camera.

programme.title: Kingdom of Plants
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores the secret life of plants at Kew, examining everything from a huge underground specimen to a snappy carnivorous variety.

programme.desc: Say hello to a season of plenty as flood waters recede and vast herds of prey return to the Chobes banks. Watch Keeza and her cub make a break for it.

programme.title: Ol Pejeta Diaries
programme.desc: Two white rhinos are moved to Ol Pejeta from a nearby ranch after they discovered that poachers had been watching the animals.

programme.title: Ol Pejeta Diaries
programme.desc: With the number of elephants on the rise, as do the numbers of conflicts. Ol Pejeta has to deal with a gang of crop raiding elephants. The order is given to detusk 3 elephants, but first the team will have to remove a collar from a blind elephant.

programme.title: Orangutan Jungle School
programme.desc: Dilla gives birth unexpectedly at midnight, but the delivery does not go smoothly. Plus, international celebrity, albino orangutan Alba, is released into the wild after rehabilitation.

programme.title: Ol Pejeta Diaries
programme.desc: A look at the plight of chimpanzees that survive the bush meat trade to become captive animals. Sweetwater sanctuary is home to 50 chimpanzees. At the same time, we look at the reintroduction of colubus monkeys into the Ewaso river area of Ol Pejeta.

programme.title: Ol Pejeta Diaries
programme.desc: Ol Pejeta Conservancy is Kenyas largest and busiest private game reserve, a vast reserve that covers 85.000 acres and is home to over 15.000 animals, including some of Africas rarest and most endangered species.

programme.title: Monkey Life
programme.desc: Chimpanzee Charlie has to undergo emergency dental surgery, but the damage is worse than expected. Meanwhile, Ro-Ro has trouble feeding her new baby, and chimp Seamus has failed to make any friends in Hananyas group, so he moves back to his old nursery troop.

programme.title: Monkey Life
programme.desc: Carli and Gypsy, the two newest chimp hooligans join the boisterous bachelor group, and Jim and Alison are on a rescue mission to Hungary to collect stump-tailed macaque Koko, who has been living in a pet-shop cage for 20 years.

programme.title: Tales from Zambia
programme.desc: We travelled alongside Africas animals on our own journey of evolution, yet intelligence took us on a different path.

programme.title: Orangutan Jungle School
programme.desc: Clara and her daughter Clarita are chosen for release back into the wild and set off on a dangerous journey to the protected wilderness. But a flash flood threatens their convoy.

programme.title: Wildlife ER
programme.desc: Head into surgery with Mara the koala, who needs a life-saving tooth operation, then assess an injured sugar glider with vet Tim. Cheer as rescue officer Elise pulls a flying fox out of a gutter and see nurse Brees clutch of python eggs hatch.

programme.title: Malawi Wildlife Rescue
programme.desc: Amanda and Mandy try every trick in the book to help a snared hyena, a lion threatens a village, and the teams plan to release a troop of 13 monkeys is thwarted by last-minute surgery and some crafty escape artists.

programme.title: Africas Hunters
programme.desc: An intimate insight into the lives of the prominent wild predators of Africa as they face their daily struggles.

programme.title: Undiscovered Vistas
programme.desc: The wild Pacific coast of Vancouver Island is an ancient and rugged landscape off the western shore of British Columbia. From the icy peaks of age-old mountain glaciers to the fog-shrouded canopies of Canadas only rainforest, its the wettest place in North America: a primitive habitat where the Pacific ocean holds the key to life and where nature and the human spirit coexist.

programme.title: Arabian Seas
programme.desc: As the sun heats the waters, algae spread across the coral reef and attract thousands of fish.

programme.title: Jamie Oliver: Fast and Simple

programme.title: Jamie Oliver: Fast and Simple

programme.sub-title: Cantina Culture and the Morning After?

programme.sub-title: The Roscoe Family Legacy: Alabama Pit Ribs

programme.sub-title: Red Curry Braised Pork with Mustard Greens

programme.title: Barbecue: Life of Fire

programme.title: Barbecue: Life of Fire

programme.title: Andrew Zimmerns Wild Game Kitchen
programme.desc: Andrew Zimmern showcases quail two ways: classic Southern fried quail with lemon-basil aioli, and as an elevated topping for a traditional open-fire paella, complete with crispy socarrat. He proves this small bird makes an extraordinary dinner.

programme.title: Andrew Zimmerns Wild Game Kitchen
programme.sub-title: Grilled Squid Salad and Crispy Squid on the Plancha
programme.desc: Andrew Zimmern creates a vibrant salad where grilled squid is served with shaved fennel, cherry tomatoes, endive, and a lemon dressing. Then, Andrew shares his country-style squid on the plancha with fresh breadcrumbs, chilies, and a homemade aioli.

programme.title: Andrew Zimmerns Wild Game Kitchen
programme.sub-title: Striped Bass Crudo and Smoky Summer Succotash
programme.desc: Chef Andrew Zimmern celebrates summers bounty with an elegant bass crudo and a whole roasted striped bass topped with an herb-packed compound butter and served alongside a smoky corn succotash studded with charred poblanos.

programme.title: Andrew Zimmerns Wild Game Kitchen
programme.desc: Andrew Zimmern explores Minnesotas forests for wild mushrooms. He creates a simple grilled mushroom salad, then hand-shapes cavatelli pasta tossed with golden chanterelles, butter, garlic, thyme, and colatura. He shares foraging and cleaning tips.

programme.title: Andrew Zimmerns Wild Game Kitchen
programme.desc: Andrew Zimmern breaks down a whole rabbit to grill with a spicy, Sichuan sauce and plate with panzanella.

programme.title: Andrew Zimmerns Wild Game Kitchen
programme.desc: Andrew Zimmern transforms wild duck into a simple grilled appetizer inspired by Japanese tataki and then uses the rest of the duck to make open fire duck noodle soup with fresh egg noodles, lots of aromatic herbs, bean sprouts and squeeze of lime.

programme.title: Andrew Zimmerns Wild Game Kitchen
programme.desc: Andrew butchers a whole pheasant to make yakitori-style skewers and a homemade flatbread, cucumber salad and a mango chutney.

programme.title: Andrew Zimmerns Wild Game Kitchen
programme.desc: Andrew Zimmern champions the often-overlooked mackerel with a main salad of pickled filets, charred tomatoes, grilled frisee, and sweet summer peaches. Then, he grills it whole seasoned with caramelized onions, rutabaga mash and charred grapes.

programme.title: Andrew Zimmerns Wild Game Kitchen

programme.title: Andrew Zimmerns Wild Game Kitchen

programme.desc: Tom is a little too much like his mother, and all work and no play makes Tom a dull boy, so Charlie attempts to come up with ways to involve him in team activities.

programme.title: Secret Army
programme.desc: Communist Max Brocard exposes his true allegiance by causing a death.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The Tunnels of Gibraltar were a Second World War espionage base, hidden in the Rock of Gibraltar, which lay undiscovered for decades. At Atlas-1 Test Site, are the remains of an ingenious US Airforce project that continues to keep people safe.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: In the Scottish capital of Edinburgh, hidden from view, a series of vaults tell a murky story of opportunity, crime and destitution. At Fort Schwatka Unalaska are the remains of an Alaskan battleground, where a foreign invader set foot on American soil for the first time since 1812.

programme.title: Villages by the Sea
programme.desc: Archaeologist, Ben Robinson visits the east coast village of Flamborough which sits on a rugged headland sticking out into the North Sea. A largely unassuming village today, it was once effectively cut off from the rest of the country by a five-metre-deep, two-and-a-half-mile long man-made dyke, re-enforced and fortified with local chalk. As Ben discovers when he visits two of the villages most prominent structures, chalk plays a large part in the history of Flamborough.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Research into why and how large projects were built, the financial and social costs of their failure, and the consequences for the environment. Experts present plans to make something new from the ruins.

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: Anna and Darren treat a woman who is suffering from terminal cancer, and Jamie and Jason see a familiar face when they are called to the home of his elderly grandfather.

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Sarahs expecting twins. She and her mum Pat are both midwives and have to overcome their professional concerns to concentrate on the babies safe arrival.

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Lesley got pregnant with a sperm donor, and plans to raise her child alone. Jody and Chris couldnt conceive, and adopted a son. Then a last try with IVF had surprising results.

programme.title: Ambulance Australia
programme.desc: The high volume of Saturday night calls contributes to severe delays at Liverpool Hospital, leading to a shortage in ambulances and long wait times for patients. Out on the streets, paramedics struggle to free patients from the wreckage of a horrific motor vehicle accident, deal with an intoxicated man with injuries, and worry about the possibility of a traumatic brain injury.

programme.title: Ambulance Australia
programme.desc: A call taker tries to revive a hanging patient over the phone when the family has already given up, and a heart attack turns into a race against the clock. A double stabbing pushes the NSW Ambulance services to their limits, while an elderly patient in late-stage emphysema shares her most intimate stories.

programme.title: DNA Family Secrets
programme.desc: Stacey is in Liverpool to meet Richard, who is on a life-long mission to discover the identity of his father - hes blown away when he finally learns the truth.

programme.title: Great Indian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Guided by his Bradshaws 1913 Handbook of Indian, Foreign and Colonial Travel, Michael Portillo embarks on a classic rail journey from Amritsar to Shimla. Along the way he helps to feed the thousands at the worlds largest free kitchen and travels the railway routes used by millions of migrants during Partition. He gives his trademark colourful wardrobe an Indian twist.

programme.title: Great Indian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael embarks on a rail journey from the Thar Desert in Rajasthan to the Indian capital, taking in desert landscapes and dazzling historic palaces. From Jodhpur, Michael strikes out into the desert, taking a camel ride to a village where life has changed little in centuries, before embarking on the Jaipur-Agra-Delhi `Golden Triangle tour, Indias must-do itinerary in 1913 as today.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek takes a shine to a rare 1958 Armstrong Siddeley Sapphire with a long family history and a convertible Triumph Herald brings a few smiles on auction day.

programme.title: World at War
programme.desc: While the full force of the Nazi war machine sweeps across Europe, an uneasy calm settles on Britain as Churchill replaces Chamberlain as prime minister.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team are in County Durham for a visit to The Bowes Museum. Objects under scrutiny include a silver box given in thanks when troops liberated the Netherlands in World War Two, some of the most valuable chairs seen on the show, and a bust reputed to be cursed.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team of experts welcome thousands to Bletchley Park near Milton Keynes, home of the Enigma code-breaking team in World War Two. Objects under scrutiny include a pair of important and valuable candlesticks, pieces rescued from the golden age of British liners, and intriguing evidence of early encounters with the Beatles. Plus, theres a surprise appearance from an airborne visitor.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: The Mathewson family continue their pursuit of classic cars. In the home counties, Derek picks up two expertly crafted replicas of the batmobile. Meanwhile, Dave struggles to contain his enthusiasm for a Second World War Ford jeep.

programme.desc: Paul picks up a stunning 1961 Vauxhall Cresta, Dave drools over a Ford Sierra Sapphire Cosworth, and Derek refuses a test drive in the worlds smallest production car, the 3.5 horsepower Peel P50.

programme.title: World at War
programme.desc: Despite having the largest pre-war European army, Frances outdated forces were humiliated by the Germans. Identifying a weakness in the Maginot Line, a defensive border which ran along the north east of France but did not extend to the channel in the west, German air and armour power simply skirted the line in the north and forged south.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: A return visit to Bletchley Park near Milton Keynes with Fiona Bruce and the team of specialists. Plus, a stunning Art-Deco brooch brings the house down.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team visit Burghley House near Stamford in Lincolnshire. Objects exciting the experts include a valuable Lalique figure bought in a junk shop for under £1, an exquisitely carved model ship made by Napoleonic prisoners of war, and a rare medal awarded to an heroic pigeon. Plus, the valuation on a collection of cherished boxes prompts a brilliant reaction.

programme.title: Indian Ocean with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: Simon Reeve travels from the coral coast of Kenya to the troubled Horn of Africa on the third leg of his Indian Ocean journey. programme.desc: Three brothers, Shivaay, Omkara, and Rudra, maintain their close relationship despite all the conflicts in their family.

programme.title: A Flying Jatt

programme.title: Pyar Jhukta Nahin
programme.desc: Ajay Khanna works as a Photographer. He meets a woman, rescues her from goons, they start to like each other and eventually, fall in love.

programme.title: Raid
programme.desc: A fearless income tax officer carries out a raid at the mansion of a powerful man in Lucknow.

programme.title: Shandaar
programme.desc: Shanker tries to expose the corrupt activities of Arjun Chaurasia, an industrialist and a politician. However, Arjun hires Dhaga, a gangster, to get rid of Shanker.

programme.title: Rashtra Kavach Om
programme.desc: In his pursuit of an advanced military technology called "Kavach", an Indian para-commando must confront the ghosts of his past, haunting him from Kasauli to Armenia.

programme.title: Kanjoos Makhichoos
programme.desc: A man covertly saves money to fulfil his fathers desire to go on the Char Dham Yatra. However, things change when his parents go missing due to heavy floods.

programme.desc: To empower her marginalised Chitta community, Jagriti challenges the age-old traditions and locks horns with its leader who works for the mafia.
